reviewDescription: Used on 38in LG. Indicated a 5/32 size drill bit for screws but I had to keep going up until I got to a 7/32 which is what actually fit the screws. Instructions were also very confusing and not friendly for first time users. I didn't use anchors because I was confused if I needed them or not for wood studs based on instructions and since they were too big for my 1/4 bit, so hopefully it holds. Sturdy so far. You get what you pay for.

I wish I had paid better attention to the reviews of this.  What is most frustrating is that you can go back years on this mount and see the same complaints repeated.  Amazon is still producing and selling a clearly faulty product (the built-in mount is garbage - I experienced this myself and many other reviews confirm it) and despite the many complaints they have apparently made no changes to the product.  Another review also mentions something I found as well, it is impossible to get this thing hung if you don't have the arms in a tilted position.  It is hard to explain, but this little metal piece jets out the less tilt you have, taking up the space you need to hook the mount.  We could not for the life of us get the tv to hook (and keep in mind this is a 70 pound 75" TV, so the longer it takes to hook it the more frustrating and straining it gets).  So we set it back down, added extra tilt (and thats when I saw the design flaw), and then guess what?  It hooked first try no problems.  But then of course, the fact that it was not level was super obvious.  I should have returned it immediately, but I had no motivation to go back through the mounting process again after all that.  And now I'm out of of the return window, of course.  Listen to the reviews and skip this.

This is the second time we purchased this mount for the same model TV. First one about 3 years ago, perfect. This one arrived in a box, looking undamaged, but one mount arm was bent nearly 1/2".  I was able to straighten it to use it. The bushings that fit into pockets on the TV were about .050 too large on the diameter to drop into the pockets. I was able to purchase nylon bushings at a hardware store in order to finish this project. Frustrating at best.
Hard to understand the directions for hanging.  Even confusing for hubby (retired carpenter).  Still in the box.  Looks well-built otherwise

reviewTitle: Does not fit every TV properly.
reviewDescription: I put this on my Toshiba 42" tv, barely. Goo thing my TV does not weight very much, or I would have sent this back. The mounting bracket on back of the TV barley works. On two of the brackets, I was only able to put in one screw while securing it to the mounting bracket. I would not buy this item again.

reviewTitle: Please note it's only a signal connector to your wall.
reviewDescription: One of the issues (I wish I looked at the picture better) is that this is a single stud connector, which means it will be really hard to center on certain walls, returning because I am in a situation It will be very off center of the wall.
Some bolts are missing.  Now I have to buy to be able to use this product.I don't want to return it. It's a good quality item and I don't want to go through returns and refunds...

reviewTitle: Couldn’t figure out how to assemble even with durections
reviewDescription: I returned

reviewTitle: Does not fit Sony Bravia tv - DO NOT PURCHASE
reviewDescription: This kit comes with multiple choices for screws, but none of them fit the Sony 55" Bravia TV. I had to order those separately. Waste of money and time!

If the studs behind your wall have standard 16-in spacing AND your studs happen to be located exactly in the right spot where you want to mount the TV, then this TV wall mount will work fine. However, if you want to mount the TV a few inches further to the left or a couple of inches further to the right from where the studs are then you're out of luck. I returned this wall mount and ordered a different one which has holes all along the top and bottom so it will give me the ability to attach the TV mount to the wall wherever I want rather than being forced to attach the wall mount only exactly where the studs are.

I have wall mounted over a dozen TV's over the past few years with ease. Whether mounting into a stud or drywall only, I have never ran into issues. However, this product was the a greater nuisance than the worst headache I have ever encountered. I was attempting to mount my TV (55") in a wall that did not have studs, as it is an exterior wall. It would not have been a problem, had the screw holes in the mount been slightly larger. As a result of the painfully small diameter of the mounting holes in the product, I could not use the strongest drywall screws on the market. As you can see, this translated to four various iterations of drywall screws and three trips to Ace Hardware to complete this task, and there are a dozen ripe scars in my wall now to show for it.Long story short, the design is flawed. The strict vertical mounting mechanism places too much stress on the top screw hole. If it is not screwed into a stud, the mount will give at the top screw and you better hope you're close enough to catch the TV before it crashes to the ground. I was able to mount my TV for a solid 4 weeks until I heard a slow hissing sound from my wall. Seconds later, the drywall gave out and I had to save the device from splitting on the tile while it was ripping out of the wall. Very disappointed with the product, do not buy unless you are prepared to perfectly align the poorly designed product with a wall stud. Otherwise, kiss your TV and drywall goodbye.

While installing the bracket on the back of my TV, a screw wouldn't go in all the way and got stuck on it. I spent two hours trying to get the screw unstuck, and still am unable to. While trying to remove the screw, the mounting point broke. My TV is now basically unusable because it doesn't have legs and now I can't mount it. Amazon was unwilling to compensate me for my broken TV, the best they could offer was 35% refund without returning the mount, or a full refund if I returned it. Very, very disappointed with Amazon's customer service. A $30 TV mount ended up costing me a new TV.

reviewTitle: Cheap screws, missing nuts, inferior product
reviewDescription: I bought this for a guest room, and I didn't want to break the bank so I went with the Amazon brand. A mistake. This product is perfect for my tv but imperfectly manufactured. The provided wall mount screws (TS) were easily stripped. The mounting bracket it's self was missing a nut meaning the TV must be in the tilt position. AND the worst part- the directions require you to use a 5/32 bit to drill pilots into the wall. This is too small resulting in screws that cannot get all the way into the wall. I had to start over with a larger bit and by the then the screw were stripped because they are inferior metal. Due to this, the mount pulled away from the wall slightly so it was unsafe. What should have taken 30 minutes took 3 hours.

reviewTitle: I do not recommend this mount
reviewDescription: I don’t understand how this is a full motion mount. It isn’t. I can’t even tilt the tv simply, instead I have to adjust some screws in order for the tv to tilt. There are better mounts out there, where you can move your tv any which way without adjusting screws.Another con, the TV looks straight in some positions but in others it looks crooked. I regret buying this mount. I should have done my research and remembered to find a mount where you can easily adjust the positioning of the tv horizontally, vertically and tilt. They are out there.

reviewTitle: The TV mount fell off the wall after 5 months
reviewDescription: I purchased this TV mount with high expectations, but unfortunately, my experience has been quite disappointing. Initially, the mount seemed sturdy and reliable. Installation was straightforward, and the mount held my TV securely in place. However, after just 5 months, the mount came out of the wall, causing significant damage to both my wall and the TV.The mount's failure has left me questioning its quality and durability. It's concerning that a product designed to hold a valuable item like a TV would fail in such a short amount of time. I made sure to follow all installation instructions carefully and used the recommended hardware, so I am certain that the issue lies with the mount itself.Overall, I am very disappointed with this purchase. I would advise potential buyers to look for a more reliable and durable TV mount to avoid similar issues. This product failed to meet my expectations and has caused more trouble than it’s worth.

You definitely get what you pay for, there are other wall mounts sold at big box stores that are better than this. Mounted to the wall, perfectly level, moving the TV around on the mount and somehow the thing gets skewed. Getting the TV positioned well is also a chore and a half, just not a user friendly design. Would have sent this back if I could have just set the TV on a credenza or table.

It will absolutely hold your TV on the wall, but I’d recommend putting some headache medicine in your cart if you order this thing. The screws are cheap phillips head screws and they stripped almost immediately, making it a total pain to install (even in pre-drilled holes). Just spend like $5 extra and save yourself the hassle.

I understand that basic means basic, but some of us need written instructions along with pictures. I had to view a video that someone posted to figure out that I don’t need the extension arms mounted on the back of my TV. Geezus. That was unnecessary time wasted.Now it’s on to figuring out which of the two of the bazillion screws will I need to complete the job.

So this tv does what it is supposed to do, except install was a pain in the butt. I'm the type that does read the instructions BEFORE I even begin to install, and this case was no different. I felt confident in doing what was required, got it put up on the wall in a stud, and then went to apply the tv. I made sure the mount was level before I put on my TV. As soon as my tv was put on, the level was way off.  The level that came with it still said it was level. So I took the tv off, and took the mount off to retry installation.So this next time, I got my own level, not the one that came with it. Redid my holes, checked with my good level, things were going good. Put my tv back on, I'll be ****ed if the thing was way off level again.Took it all back down a second time, started boxing stuff up to send back to amazon for a refund. This was junk. Base was level, but the arms were not. As I was boxing up the stand, I noticed that the two screws that connected the tv to the mount, well, those two screw holes were arched for adjustment. This was where you did your final level adjustments. This was not in the instructions at all. Nowhere at all. You would think that this important bit of info would be in those instructions. But no, they were too worried about using the same manual to house 10 different languages.I have decided to keep it, instead of returning it, simply because I finally got it level and it was a pain in the ass, not going to take it down again. But if you are someone who will want to move your tv from angle to angle, side to side.... Just know that when you move it, you have to relevel the **** thing again. You've been warned.

Everything looked like it was going to be great, until the small threads that keep the mount to the tv split.  I have the tools to fix it, but most dont.Carefully thread everything Its made in China with no room for error

The instructions for the TV mount were absolutely terrible after getting it mounted on the wall getting the TV actually on the wall mount was not only super super hard not very sturdy. Had to end up screwing the back mount onto the TV while another person was holding it. Do not recommend.
The product is fine but the instructions are the worst I have ever see.  There are no words, only pictures with three different options for each picture.
product does not level consistently

reviewTitle: Do not use use their anchors
reviewDescription: First of all the directions are terrible. Second, the anchors are not capable of holding anything over 30 lbs. Do not purchase this product!

I followed all the instructions in the manual which is included in the box, such as proper attachment and alignment as well. I just got 36 inches tv but unfortunately it fell. maybe due to poor quality of the product. this is frustrating, now it would be more expensive for me since I need to buy a new tv. for the company who made this one, please at least compensate me for the damage that you've done for my tv. hope for your consideration regarding this issue. please for those new buyers, take time to read reviews and search for quality.

First, don’t depend on the instructions. They are both vague and overly wordy (took a lot of work to pull that off). The illustrations are too small and ambiguous. So, you’ll need to schedule extra time for putting it up. I had to backtrack several times and redo the steps. Second, I found the included hardware inadequate. Made two trips to the hardware store (god bless Ace hardware) for additional spacers. The ones included were less than just inadequate. I’ve bought and installed more than a dozen flat screen wall mounts over the years, and this one was absolute crap. It truly deserves the name “basic.” On the other hand, I did like the packaging! Cardboard, no Styrofoam.

reviewTitle: Plastic panel on the back does not work as intended
reviewDescription: The design of the product includes a plastic panel intended to conceal the screw holes, which could be a neat touch for maintaining a sleek aesthetic. However, the execution falls short of its purpose. The panel fails to stay in place, resulting in a loose and dangling piece of plastic. This not only detracts from the overall look of the item but also hints at a possible oversight in design or manufacturing quality. For future iterations, a more reliable mechanism to secure the panel would be greatly beneficial, ensuring the item’s appearance remains tidy and intact as intended.

Worst instructions ever. IKEA furniture has better instructions than this pos. Trying to mount it on Amazon 43” TV is like trying to decipher 1/2 the Chinese instructions it came with. It’s easier to understand a stroke victim than Amazons instructions.
Bought used - like new. Was basically missing every screw I needed to mount / secure tv. I spent more money getting replacement screws than I did on the mount.

My installer said he couldn't use this product for my TV because it's too heavy. Unfortunately,  I am not given the option to return it so I'm stuck with a useless piece of equipment.  My advice is to let a professional provide the equipment and install it!

This mounting system is fine with regard to its design, and Amazon Basics are usually pretty good. But this was a real dud. I used the included M6 screws to attach my TV, but the the included alleged M6-sized washers, which are absolutely required, were too small! That is, the diameters of the screw holes were too small to let the screws through. With the bracket already carefully mounted to my wall, I had one of two choices: go to the hardware store to buy some appropriately sized washers, or bore the washers myself with a drill. I chose the drill. And neither option is hard to do, but you have to know what to do. What is someone who isn’t handy supposed to do? They would be INCREDIBLY frustrated, stuck with a partially mounted bracket!After installing it, the mount itself works perfectly.
The mounting bracket is sturdy but with the TV added, the entire mount came off the stud cracking the drywall.

Not as substantial as expected, with limited articulation. Plus, the directions were unclear.  To assemble the TV mount properly,  you had to put the Amazon Basics name against the back of the TV. I later bought a Sanus mount that was about $40-50 more, bit it was FAR more substantial,  with CONSIDERABLY more articulation.

Instructions suck. Better off watching videos or figuring out how to install it yourself. Mounting bracket is easy to install if you know your basics about finding a stud/dry wall install. The issue is the bracket on the tv. Too many pieces and parts that’ll confuse you. Once mounted on the tv it does not feel sturdy. It feels like the tv can fall off at any time because the hook is so shallow. Be cautious on how you turn it.Although installed properly, my tv keeps tilting right and is crooked. Don’t know if it can support it well.Doesn’t seem like a universal mount. For reference I have a 50” Samsung tv with a flat surface.

The lag bolts are a 25/64 which is the most random socket size ive ever seen. Of course my closest socket was just over that size. Alot of work to install a simple mount for a 32" TV. The mount for my 75" was way easier to install.
This product was very difficult to put together. The instructions weren't clear. Very confusing. So I used all my own materials, & imagination to figure it out. I do not recommend it.

So after installing the mount and hanging my 42" tv from it and confirming it was level. I discovered the mount sags when fully extended with TV on it.  This requires readjusting the mount, which will requires more work to adjust accordingly. When not fully extended my tv is level without issue.

reviewTitle: Took two men hours to finally get it right
reviewDescription: The manual and instruction is confusing. The bolts and rings are not correct size. We hired a professional handyman. It was even difficult for him to get this thing leveled and installed. We couldn't use the bolt came with the package to drill tot he wall because it's too long. It hit our brick! We ended up buying a shorter bolt...The mount is great quality but I highly suspect the design of this mount. It's single leg while stationary should be fine. If you plan to maneuver the TV often times, then it might not be a durable mount. I suspect the latter scenario/usage will make it unstable and potentially having the TV fall off the wall.

Prepare for a time of frustration and a headache. When you’ve finally drilled the holes where the screws need to go in the wall, make sure you have some better quality screws on hand, because at the slightest application of force from your drill the screw loses its + shape and becomes round, loosing all of its grip. You’ll spend the next 30 minutes running the screws in the wall with a wrench. What a pain!

Tightening the screws into the wall was down by hand. Somehow I managed to sheer the head of the center bolt off however the two on top and bottom seem to be plenty to support the 32” tv that it is currently holding up. I’m not worried about it however when we get a bigger tv I will get a better quality Mount for it.In addition to that the leveling screws came with one stripped so while I’m able to “lock it in” with the other screw the level will never stay. Again with a small tv this is fine. It’s light snd nothing is heavy on one side versus the other but going forward I’ll get higher quality mounts like the one we bought for our 55”.I almost forgot.. the faceplate that supposedly covers where the mount connects with the wall won’t stay up. I don’t see anything that would keep it in place so right now it’s being held to the wall by sliding the cord organizer up against it.

reviewTitle: Perfect fit for my Amazon Fire 50 inch TV
reviewDescription: This was a great TV mount for my new Fire TV 50 inch. My wife always wanted our TV mounted on the wall so that she could swivel it outward and watch it in the kitchen while she's cooking. This mount allows for just that.I recommend watching a video or two online to get a basic idea of how to install this thing. The instructions are pretty basic - just pictures - and if you have never done this before, just pictures isn't enough (at least not for me). I took off one star for that. Fortunately the VESA mounting system works for all VESA compatible TVs/Monitors. There are a LOT of options of course, and figuring out which one works for your TV is the only real hard part.The package includes a dizzying array of hardware to accommodate all the various VESA configurations. It also includes drywall expanders in case you can't find a stud - which I think is crazy! I STRONGLY recommend you DO NOT use these and mount this directly to a 2x4 in your wall! Once mounted on a 2x4, you can feel how solid and strong the hold is on this mount. I think drywall expanders would be dicey at best to hold the TV safely.To adjust the horizontal direction or to pull the TV out further from the wall is simple and easy. The motion is smooth and easy to do. Adjusting the TILT is not so easy and requires you to loosen two nuts behind the TV.  That is the ONLY thing that is even remotely annoying about the operation of this mount. Though I really don't know if any other TV mount would allow for an easier tilt adjustment. Fortunately, I'm happy to set a slight downward tilt and don't foresee adjusting that at all.The mount has a good range of motion and can almost allow you to turn the TV at a 45 degree angle - almost - but not quite. I'd say it's more like a 30 degree rotation. But that's pretty good for today's wide screen TV's!Overall I think this is an excellent value and works perfectly!

reviewTitle: Stop Whatever You're Doing and Order this Mount!
reviewDescription: The Full Motion Articulating TV Monitor Wall Mount has truly revolutionized my home entertainment experience! From the moment I installed it, I was blown away by the incredible flexibility and convenience it offers.First and foremost, the build quality is outstanding. The mount is constructed from robust, high-grade materials that ensure both durability and stability. It securely holds my TV, giving me complete confidence that it’s safe and well-supported. The sleek design also adds a modern touch to my living room, complementing my home decor perfectly.What sets this wall mount apart is its full-motion articulation. The range of motion is impressive, allowing me to swivel, tilt, and extend the TV to find the perfect viewing angle from anywhere in the room. Whether I’m watching a movie from the couch, cooking in the kitchen, or doing a workout on the floor, I can easily adjust the TV to suit my needs. The smooth, effortless adjustments make it incredibly user-friendly.Installation was surprisingly straightforward. The included instructions were clear and detailed, and all the necessary hardware was provided. I had the mount up and ready in no time, and the adjustable arms made it easy to position the TV exactly where I wanted it.Another fantastic feature is the cable management system. It keeps all my cables neatly organized and out of sight, contributing to a clean and clutter-free look. This small detail makes a big difference in maintaining a tidy and professional appearance.In summary, the Full Motion Articulating TV Monitor Wall Mount has far exceeded my expectations. Its sturdy construction, exceptional range of motion, easy installation, and thoughtful design features make it a standout choice for anyone looking to enhance their TV viewing experience. Highly recommended for its superior quality and unparalleled functionality!

This Amazon Basics Full Motion TV wall mount is great. I did have to have my son help me mount it to the wall because it is quite heavy, but was well worth the wait for my son to come visit. The wall mount is so sturdy and it rotates from side to side and up and down smoothly, and holds my TV very securely. Just make sure you have wall studs to mount it because it is heavy duty. Once mounted properly it is very sturdy and easy to manipulate to your satisfaction. I would definitely recommend it.

Easy to put up. The only problem that I ran into was that the screws that mount the plate to the tv were WAY too short. Maybe just that my tv is an older one. I used the screws that were in those already.  You do need to mount this to a wall joist. The stand all by itself is beefy, BUT when you place a tv on it, the pressures on those mounts must be tremendous.  Love the mount though. Good price too.

This was a good purchase. Very easy to put together and seems very sturdy. I have a 43 inch TV on it. You only need one stud which really helps in placing it where you want it and less drilling. The best part is the almost limitless directional configurations. It moves around easily but is not loose so it doesn't move by itself.  You can point your TV to the left or right and extend it from the wall over a foot away. It also lays pretty flat when you want to move it out of the way.Pay attention to the instructions. The pictures are small and there are no written descriptions. But overall, it was easy. I highly recommend for TVs from 50 inches down to 23 inches.

reviewTitle: Light weight overall compared to older units.  Excellent value.
reviewDescription: Works perfectly as advertised.  Light weight in comparison to older wall mounts.  The arm swings easily but not too loose.  My wife loves it for her home office setup.  Bought another for my daughters' TV since it works so well.  Saves space from setting TVs on furniture.
Great value for the money, good instructions and went together easily.

reviewTitle: Easy to install, everything you need
reviewDescription: I liked this mount so well, I bought 4 of them.Installation is easy: Pick the desired height, drill one hole in the stud.  Put the first bolt in loosely, level it, drill the 2nd hole.  Put the 2nd bolt in and tighten it up.  Tighten the first hole.  Now drill 3rd hole and tighten.  Put the mount on the TV.  Hang the TV on the mount.  Hanging the TV on the mount is most easily done with a 2nd person who can help you get the TV and wall mount lined up.Otherwise, everything you needed to install this was included, EXCEPT for a drill, drill bit, screw drivers and wrenches.  Most people have those tools, but if you don't - beg or borrow them from a friend.Enjoy your new mount!

I wrote in my other review about how I recently mounted a TV in my gazebo. I didn't want to have to drill or spend too much money, so I ordered some ratchet straps and the amazon basics mount. I have a 55" TV mounted to it and it's secured only by the ratchet straps and it's perfect! The mount is rock solid and comes with tons of different pieces you can use in case your tv uses an unusual mounting setup. It's been perfect for what I've needed and it's low cost.

We used this to hang a LG TV, 43". It was on the wall, I'd say in about 30 minutes from opening the box to finish.  Easy to install, directions were mostly pictures but it was relatively user friendly.  On the instructions, where it lists out different screws/washers - that is basically giving you the various combinations that might work. So you don't need all of them, it's just saying you might need screw J, but you might need something else instead, not all of them.  Once we figured that out, it was smooth sailing.

finally got this attached to wall and tv.  directions were a disaster.  spent three hours securing everything so a brand new tv would be safe.  still not confident that it is safe.would NOT buy this again

reviewTitle: WRONG install guide and video - totally waste of time with the WRONG information
reviewDescription: Contradictory information in the installation video! The hole into the wood should be larger than 4mm, otherwise the screw will NOT fit it, also need to be smaller than 8 mm. Totally misleading installation guide.Also the screws provided are not suitable for TCL TV as there is a bump behind. Looking all around home depot to look for the same size but longer screw..totally a waste of time
I’ve ordered twice now since it has such good reviews and both times I’ve been missing the extension parts. Very disappointed

This Tv Mount is not universal. The following issues were found:1) Screws are not long enough for a 50” Sony TV.2) Screws width and diameter are all different, it doesn’t come with pair of same sizes.

Followed instructions, simple enough, used stud finder and electric drill to make pilot holes and used all recommended items from instructions and after trying twice, I now have six holes on my apartment wall. Now I am needing to fill and cover up six holes because after I installed the actual mount and before even thinking about mounting my tv, I tested the mount and both times the mount AND screws came off the wall after drilling. Range of motion is great through. Easily would have been the perfect mount to put my tv and move around but range of motion should also include out and off the wall after installation.
truly hope whoever is responsible for designing this develops a terminal illness

Simular experience to another of the one star reviews. I drilled the correct size hole, 5/16", inserted the anchors but the bolts were too large and the heads stripped while I was trying to screw them in.I may run to the hardware store to fix it but that is completely unacceptable quality control and makes me really hesitant to buy Amazon Basics again.

reviewTitle: Seems like a great sturdy product but...
reviewDescription: Bought this for my 32" bedroom HDTV. Seems like overkill, but figured it would be better to just pay the extra $5 for something better. Would make future TV upgrades easier... However it doesn't work with my 32" TV.Back plate, covers the power cord plug.They'd need to include longer spacers. The ones they have are about 1 inch. Not enough to fit cords and cables behind it.If you have a big TV this works for, its probably a 5-star product. But it says compatible with 22" HDTV, which I highly doubt since its not working well with a lot of 32" TVs.

The metal used for the mounting screws is like butter. In trying to install them, they stripped no matter how gentle we were. We were completely unable to install the mount because of these trash screws. I've got to hope I can find higher quality replacement screws somewhere else, but the instruction manual provides little detail about the measurements for these screws so I have no idea how I'll do that.

reviewTitle: Does not fit Amazon's own 43" TVs
reviewDescription: This was Amazon's recommended mount for their own Amazon Fire 4k 43" TV. It does NOT fit that TV. This mount has a tiny 200mm maximum VESA pattern, instead of the 300mm pattern required by Amazon's TV. As the TV was very light, I ended up piecing together the hardware in a different way and hanging the TV off just two VESA holes. Frustrating.
Absolutely trash 👎

The quality of this mount appears to be quite good, very sturdy.  However, I wanted a  mount that could be centered and flush to the wall.  For some reason, on this design the arms are not spaced in a manner to allow a centered position when flush to a wall.  I returned the mount and got something else from Amazon which worked a whole lot better.  If you are looking for a mount that is sturdy, and NOT necessary to be centered to a wooden stud, this could be a good mount to use - as long as you do not need to have it center to a stud..
Don’t waste your time buying this one! They came up with the worst parts and you’ll be spending your day going back and forth to Home Depot or Lowe’s trying to find something that would fit better

reviewTitle: Don’t expect to hang this when received
reviewDescription: The Mount itself is very heavy so not for children’s rooms as it can fall and hurt them pretty badly. The hardware is a joke I’ve literally never seen such trashy bolts in my life. Expect a trip to your local hardware store to even be able to use these. Not only does the hardware immediately strip but they put a flat back on the hex edge so you can’t use a socket wrench if it strips. Junk. You get what you pay for buy something else.
I like commercials

If I could give 0 stars I would. This tv mount has always made noises when rotating the tv and today it fell! Just seconds after my 6 year old son rotated it in a different direction. Had this fallen on him it would’ve been a lawsuit. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS!!
Item is great. Just sent it to me without the parts. Happy to redo reviews if I get parts!

After two hours of trying to get this level when mounted we gave up.  Due to the weight of the tv (65” tv, less than 50lbs)- the extension arm could not handle the weight, causing the tv to dip down on one side about 1/2”.  Which may not seem like a big deal unless it’s only 4” down from the ceiling.  Not recommended for a large tv
The load bearing tap screws are garbage and will strip if you so much as look at them the wrong way.

It doesn't stay level.  I had a professional come and install it for $70.00 and it would be level and when it was pushed back against the wall, it wouldn't stay level any more. Very disappointed in it!!!
Not sturdy enough

reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY!! Cheap Hardware and will cause DAMAGE to your TV
reviewDescription: I installed this verbatim according to the instructions provided by Amazon. I used the hardware and wall anchors provided. My tv was a 46" flat screen that weighs maybe 40 lbs. I mounted and hung the TV and after 10 seconds the TV and mount fell from the wall pulling the wall anchors out. I spoke with Amazon customer service and was told that they would only refund my money, and not compensate me for my television because I didn't have professional installation. DO NOT BUY!!!!!!

Very disappointed with this product. The instructions basically say drill three holes and line them up. They also include dry wall anchors even though they said this mount was meant to be installed on wall studs and not dry wall. They also do not include washers for the screws that connect the mount to the wall and the screws they include don't feel very sturdy. I'm an idiot and ended up with a hole that was too big because I was trying to put the dry wall anchor in. I managed to get the screws in right but they never felt secure and the mount would slide if I bumped it. I don't feel confident having this on my wall. The part that connects to my 32 inch tv fit perfectly though. I'm usually all for amazon basics products but this was a very disappointing experience and I would not recommend this product
Those plastic anchor pieces are terrible. They do not have lips to keep from falling into the wall and made an easy job complicated cause I had to get metal ones that pulled it shut.
I’d give it a zero if I could. Installation instructions are worthless.
I’m super upset. I bought about a month ago so I can’t return but when I opened my package it was missing the piece that attaches to the tv. So it is basically useless.

reviewTitle: How Can This Possibly Be So Highly Rated?
reviewDescription: I left video review as well. I am perplexed as to how good of reviews this mount has. Mine was purchased to mount a 40 inch TV in my RV bedroom. There is absolutely NO WAY this mount would withstand even the slightest of road motion. Of course, most folks probably didn't buy this to mount in something that moves and bounces around, but it is SO loose that breathing on it too hard would probably knock it off kilter.This is the worst Amazon Basics product I have ever purchased. I would strongly suggest avoiding this item.
No additional comments.
I bought this used in good condition. So I figured it would have all the parts but no. Screws and the arms where missing. Be mindful of missing parts if you buy something used

Very cheap screws ruined this installation and no idea what to do now.  Soft metal made it impossible to use Phillips heads and only strips the heads.  Moved to manual ratchet and although slow seemed to work until the head of the screw detached.  (See pics).  Now with most of the screw in Tyhe wall but no head, what do I do?  Will definitely never buy anything branded “Amazon Basics” ever again.

I'm giving this 5 stars because the mount itself is great. It feels sturdy and looks great on the wall.However, the installation took me a long time because I don't have a ratcheting socket set. There are 3 hex head screws that are about 3 inches long and need to be threaded all the way into the wall. This is probably a breeze with a ratcheting socket set but I didn't have one on hand so I had to use the little allen key style hand wrench to get these in. It probably took about 45 minutes of twisting. Just a heads up to anyone reading this.

I had been looking for a small wall mount for a 32' tv. I didnt need anything fancy. Just to secure it to my wall so my cat wont knock my tv off again. This had me skeptical that it would be worth while at the price. But amazon basics have made me a believer in their items once again.  The instruction book was a bit of a mass mess.. but being i used to be a construction worker i was able to get it all sorted on my own. There are addition arms to add one the mount so it will fit the vesa mount on the back. Thant is always handy to have. My only issue  were the wall sinkers. To me they seemed flimsy.I ever needed i would buy another if i get a 2nd tv and i would tell people this is worth the money.
Very solid bracket.  Works great and very stable.

Impressive. I was looking to mount my Samsung 55 inch tv on a wall mount with simple swivel capabilities. I bought another brand that said it could handle up to 77 lbs of weight. My tv is 33 lbs.  I was very disappointed as the mount was somewhat light weight and had a lot of wiggle in the main connection point. So back to the drawing board. I have purchased more expensive tv mounts in the past, Kanto is very good, but was looking for something  bit more economic and simple. I ordered the Amazon Basic product after watching video. I could tell from the point of delivery it was probably better based on the weight of the package. This tv mount is simple and very sturdy, no wiggle. Easily holds the 33 lbs and probably would hold the advertised max weight with no problem. Also the tv hangs on the mount is a simple manner to allow connection and level adjustments. It is priced in the middle ground of products. If you are looking for a good, solid, straight forward swivel tv mount, this is very impressive. Depending on the your needs a higher end might be needed for more swivel range and other options. This mount will likely work on an LG tv because it has VESA standard extensions. Since LG doesn’t follow VESA, sad, the layout out the extension may be a little unusual but stable (probably two holes in main mount and two out horizontally to the other two). May need to experiment. Good luck!
Great product exactly what I needed

reviewTitle: Love these mounts with folding arms.
reviewDescription: This is the second mount I buy from Amazon.  The first was for a 100 lb TV and then this one for a 50 lb TV.  Both with folding arms.  They are sturdy and easy to install on wood studs.I will keep buying these.
NO PROBLEM INSTALLING THIS... HAS TEMPLATE AND ALL THAT IS NEEDED....

From the instructional video on amazon to the overkill in parts for potential various applications this product kept its promise. It was easy to install and the instructions were clear. The template for drilling the mounting bracket was great. The only con for me was that I am questioning the size bit they recommend for drilling the mounting holes in the wall stud. I had to go two sizes larger in order to screw the bolts in. The hex caps on the bolts were rounded so my ratchet head slipped under tension and had to use the Phillips drive but even that was was too tight using the recommended bit. This was a small issue for me because I have tools and strength, but I could see it being an issue for someone less able to adapt beyond the instructions and materials provided.

This product was a great deal.Easy to install.It came with leveling materials and everything.Solid quality.I put a TV that was a little too big on it but I knew it was okay because I wanted it to angle down just a little bit.The size works well and it's very versatile.
Good tv mount and pretty easy to install. Seems sturdy and flatly easy to adjust the viewing angles.

The construction is solid but this might not be a good pick for you if this is your first time installing one of these. This is probably the10th TV bracket I’ve installed over the course of my life and eventually you get a feel for how all of these generally work.  The instructions are not very good, and I ended up using some of my own screws and leftover components from past projects to get this mounted on my wall. That said It appears to be made well, and feels really solid.

I have this a four star because I watched my husband put this up. It was a little confusing and after it was up I can still see the back bar mounted below the TV. I think it would be better if you couldn’t see it. But it does the job.

It’s a great product and it definitely works but it is a lot more difficult than other brands. I highly recommend looking for a simpler version as this took a long time with different TVs and different screws.  The product does the job intended but it’s a lot more complex than anyone else has mentioned.

reviewTitle: Great for TVs, less great for Monitors.
reviewDescription: It still works perfectly fine, but there's little flairs added to each side of the VESA mount that sits inside the back of the monitor that makes it so it can't fit in. So I had to use longer screws and have it sit on top of the mounting bay instead of inside of it until I can get a better mount. Quality wise the thing is great, just much better for TVs than monitors.

This mount is good and sturdy. It's pretty universal and has a lot of mounting options for different screw configurations for your TV. It feels heavy duty, especially for the price.However, what should have been a really simple install turned into a bit of a nightmare. My first complaint is pretty minor - the instructions rely on pictures and there aren't any words to explain what each of the dozen or so different configuration pictures are for. It was just a bit confusing to figure out how to mount the TV bracket. Major complaint - the lag bolts are the absolute chintziest pieces of hardware I've ever used. I piloted the holes into the stud, and all three bolts just disintegrated before we could get them screwed into the wall. Not just the philips head cross, but the hex bolt head. We had to drive them in by hand with a vice grip. We'll never be able to take it off the wall at this point. It would have been faster and better to go to the hardware store for decent hardware. Really disappointed with that aspect. Do yourself a favor and get bolts that aren't made of tin foil.
Just dope
Good for the price... Arms not long enough for a 50 in TV to turn a full 180 degrees, but works nonetheless

reviewTitle: Don't be afraid of all the hardware
reviewDescription: This is a great mount for the money. When I first opened the box, I was pretty intimidated by the multitude of screws and other pieces. No need, as there are just a lot of different pieces for different televisions. Ironically, it didn't have a screw the right size and length for the bottom two threaded holes of my TV which do not allow you to screw very far into. However, I was able to use some extra spacers and make the longer screws work.I naively thought you could adjust the angle of the TV as needed. You pretty much set it and leave it by tightening screws. Should have known better at this price. The side to side adjustment is smooth, but has enough friction so that your TV doesn't move on its own.For smaller TVs, I really like the slim, one stud mounting base. It looks way better on the wall and is less work to boot. Final verdict is that if you are mounting a smaller TV, this is a winner, especially for the price.
Works great and can really hold weight. Easy install

Directions aren't worth anything, it's only pictures. Drilled my holes straight but the anchors bent going in and crinkled. Cheap!! Now that my holes are too big to HAVE to put the anchors in I attempted to screw in the screws to straighten them out and everything went haywire. They are not in the appropriate holes and now my hands are blistering from hand screwing these in all kiddy wampus! If I could give a Zero Star I would!! Now I have 3 holes in my wall and these screws won't go in any further. Thanks a lot for nothing!! Cheap anchors!!

reviewTitle: Screws not threaded and incorrect sizes
reviewDescription: Not trusting Amazon much anymore. It was VERY disappointed once the mount was in the wall to realize the holes for the screws to mount the tv to the mount were NOT threaded and also not the correct size…
The Mounting screws provided Are a very weak metal. Strip super easily, even with pre-drilled holes. Do not recommend… Have to go to the hardware store to buy extra screws to make this work.

reviewTitle: Does not even fit most recent tvs
reviewDescription: Instructions were poorly designed. Material is cheap. Had some weird sized wall anchors which no drill bit of mine would size correctly. Waste of money in my opinion. Decided to go with this one because it was Amazon basics and haven’t had issues with that brand… guess I know for my future purchases.

I was installing this into my wall, and not only did the screws strip half way into the wall, the tool also stripped itself. It's not that expensive to include quality screws at the very least. Now I have to find a way to get these cheap screws out of the wall, get my own mount screws. I'm was told I might also have to purchase a specific tool just to get the screws out of my wall. Of all the things to save money on, screws are the cheapest to purchase quality metal, and have the most potential to ruin the project in exactly what happened to me.

reviewTitle: My husband hates this tv wall mount
reviewDescription: My husband is a seasoned vet when it comes to wall mounting tv’s. The instructions were awful! The screw stripped almost immediately and we had to go out and buy more. Honestly the quality wasn’t there for us.
Do not buy this garbage. It says its compatible with up to 400mm VESA mounting but it is NOT. It is only compatible with 200mm VESA mounting. This seller is GARBAGE.

reviewTitle: Does not work for non-standard stud spacing
reviewDescription: This product is unusable for me because it does not work with non-standard stud spacing. It could have been designed with an adjustable mounting width to support 18-24" stud spacing

reviewTitle: Absolute nightmare trying to install and I am a TV Tech.
reviewDescription: Everything  is permanently anchored together with large rivets. You have to hold the TV in position and somehow figure out a method to line it up and get the screws in at the same time which are about a half an inch long, instead of sliding it apart, mounting the wall side and the TV side in two different pieces and being able to place the TV with one move.  I absolutely hate this, and would give it a minus 100 rating if I could.

The mount weighs more than my TV does, and because of that is requiring that I drill giant holes in the wall, the wall it's being mounted on isn't even thick enough for the long bolts it wants me to put through it. Not to mention the bolts are of terrible quality, as soon as they met the resistance of the stud the heads started shredding. This is an absolute trash item.

Bought this a few months ago, finally got it opened and ready to install. Disappointed that rack that goes on to the wall and bars that go onto TV are "clipped" together only by 2 clips.  No permanent attachment to each other.  Not a very secure attachment of Tv to wall. Installed and attached TV to wall mount, with hands on both sides of tv, created a movement of light shaking, TV unattached it self from wall bars. Not very secure if a little shaking happens or someone grabs it. Would return but no option in Amazon due to my having it a few months... NOT Recommended if you live in an earthquake zone or have kids.

reviewTitle: Only works correctly with monitors with flat back panels
reviewDescription: To install this mount on my TV/Monitor, I had to keep the mounting brackets above a 3" section of the monitor that protruded out along the bottom portion of the monitor.  While the bracket were able to be mounted to the monitor it lower the central pivot point so that the tilts downward and can not be easily adjusted.  I had to insert shims into the bracket to fix in into place.  This system is much less expensive than full motion mounting systems but it only works correctly with a TV/Monitor with a flat back panel.

reviewTitle: No diagrams in the instruction booklet to assemble.
reviewDescription: Instruction booklet print is very fine. No diagrams as to how to assemble the wall mount. None of the screws could fit the television I was trying to mount. I had to go to a local home depot after checking online as to what screws to buy.

I did not use because I did not assemble it. I’ve assembled many many purchases but not even a six-pack of beer gave me the courage to tackle the assembly with its confusing instructions and close to 100 parts.

Mounted a 80" TV well within the weight rating. Mounting brackets flex badly when TV is mounted. Any touch causes the TV to bounce. Additionally, you can't get the screws tight enough to prevent the TV from sagging and pointing towards the ground--it won't stay parallel with the wall.Returned.

reviewTitle: A Prime Member Only. NO Compensation for this Review
reviewDescription: CANNOT RECOMMEND.Here's Why:There are ONLY TWO  tiny 1/4" SCREWS provided to attach the thick/heavy mounting bracket screwed into the back of the TV to the thick/heavy bracket screwed into the wall!ITS HARD TO BELIEVE THEY WILL HOLD!Also,  tiny screws makes it very difficult to get your fingers or a tool around them while installing. I wanted to return it but my son didn't want the hassle.  He paid for it so it was 'his call'. I won't be surprised to hear his expensive TV crashing to the ground one day.

The quality of the mount is great however the mount itself is horrible. I mounted my 50inch TV to the wall and while the mounting process was relatively simple, the tv is slanted at an odd angle (the screen is almost facing up toward the ceiling) I’m POSITIVE I did everything right so I’m not sure if I got one that was tilted or defective. I also feel like it is better on the smaller end of the range of TVs. While the material is sturdy, it doesn’t look big enough for my 50 inch

Pretty infuriating on the install, have installed several other brands/makes of mounts. Make sure you have the stud spacing and tv centering figured out before your buy it, otherwise you’ll be using every piece and spacer to make the offsets correct.

reviewTitle: Can’t take the weight when extended
reviewDescription: I bought this mount because it was the recommend mount for my 43 inch fire TV. It is screwed into a stud, but it sort of says when extended.

reviewTitle: Hardware terrible.  Supplied stud screws are way too short.
reviewDescription: Yeah, this is garbage.  All the supplied screws are crap.  The anchor screws are way too short.  Not happy, and too late to return.

reviewTitle: Very sturdy when mounted into a stud
reviewDescription: Be careful when you're hanging the TV on the mount support circle it looks like it's on there but it might not be... When the TV is straight out it's level but when you fold the mount back it's crooked...
The instructions or lack thereof were simply diagrams with no writing. After two frustrating hours we finally decided to look up YouTube videos. The mount is universal, the instructions are not.
the mount works fine for my tv, it moves out and pushes into the wall no problem. the directions can be a bit confusing

This one's not on you I ordered the wrong once I did like them they were on the wall they were okay just wasn't what I thought I was ordering I'm some of these stuff that I need I'm not sure so trial and error it's all good I've got two receivers that I'm stuck with but trust me I'm going to figure out a way so I like them they're all right I got them in a box warn them laugh out loud. I'm just joking I hope you have a sense of humor
We were able to figure out how to use this but the directions were worse than buying from IKEA.

reviewTitle: Plan for some sag when mounting.
reviewDescription: I measured the distance from the mounting points to entertainment center top when mounting, gave myself what I thought was 1/2" clearance or more. Unfortunately after mounting the ≈35lb TV the arm had enough flex/bending to drop over an inch when slightly out and more when all the way out  so I've got to drill 3 more holes in the wall and move it up an inch or two.

reviewTitle: Decent product / but buy new mounting screws
reviewDescription: Decent product / serves intended purpose / but agree with other comments / best to buy own separate stud mounting bolts / I used 1/4 x 2 in lag screws / Home Depot - rather than what was provided - they did not seem the best material / but bracket was good and install was simple for my 32 in
Good for the price
Works.

reviewTitle: Good mount with one big issue
reviewDescription: This mount does as it says, holds up to 40in TVs, but it is VERY hard to install a TV on this by yourself. no way to hold the TV for the sake of screwing it securely, we needed 2 people of decent strength to do it. otherwise of okay build quality.

Sturdy, heavy duty unit. Too bad Amazon didn’t take the next step and include instructions that were readable and understandable. The directions were a total waste of paper. I managed to get it installed in spite of the attempt to make it easy. It could have got 5 stars if not for that

reviewTitle: Built-in level is WRONG - Good price, just use your own level!
reviewDescription: We installed this and leveled it using the built-in level. Put our tv up on it and the tv was visibly tilted. We pulled out our own level and it read as being angled. Had to uninstall it, shift it to drill new holes, and use our separate level. Good price, just use your own level!!!

reviewTitle: Does not fit 43” Amazon Fire Omni TV
reviewDescription: Fun Fact: This 12” to 43” Amazon mount does not fit Amazon’s 43” TV.

reviewTitle: Review for: "Full Motion Articulating TV Wall Mount for ...
reviewDescription: Review for: "Full Motion Articulating TV Wall Mount for 22-inch to 55-inch"It works, but the instructions tell you to use drywall anchors when hanging on the stud while the provided anchors are nearly as long as the screw. I managed to install it luckily because the last maybe 1/4" of the screw had some bite while the rest (as per the instructions was drilled out too wide for the supplied screws.)

reviewTitle: Directions are a little hard to follow. You definitely ...
reviewDescription: Directions are a little hard to follow.  You definitely want a ratcheting wrench set that has metric sockets, the included bolts are not US standard.Also, if using the smallest mounting holes (like the TCL 43" TV), then you might want to track down your own washers.  The included ones have a inner diameter size that matches the small bolt head, so some bolts may slide through, which is a pain.

The hole pattern fit perfectly for the Samsung 55” 6 Series NU6950, however the screws provided to attach the plate to the back of the TV are not longer enough.Build quality looks fine and sturdy. Looks like a good mount, just didn’t come with enough screw sizes to mount the plate to the back.

I have a 55" LG LED TV and this seemed like the perfect mount with it's full motion capabilities, however, I discovered that the main mounting plate is so large it completely obstructs the input panel of the TV. I tried using the included spacers to provide room, but it is still not enough. Warning to potential buyers, be aware of this issue! I have an LG 55LF6000.

reviewTitle: Missing piece cant hang it up.
reviewDescription: I am missing a piece I received 3 out of the 4 metal things that attaches to the tv. Super upset I was looking forward to hanging my tv up today and cant. Can someone please contact me to have the missing piece mailed.

reviewTitle: Cheap material. Worth spending more on something else.
reviewDescription: Not heavy duty at all. One of the two bolts that holds the Tv mount to the wall mount and controls the tilt of the mount broke down the middle. It's a very important part and it's made of low quality material.

It is very sturdy and not too hard to install.  It isn't suitable for a small to medium sized room. When you push it close to the wall,  it doesn't go straight back,  but to the side. To keep it straight,  it has to be kept out several inches from the wall.
Tighten the crossbolts on the base before you hang the TV on it. Otherwise it will not stay where you angle it.

reviewTitle: My go to TV wall mount system!
reviewDescription: 5th one purchased 4th one received. Just like anything in life nothing is perfect. This system for mounting full size tvs is simple straightforward and very functional. The mounting plate attached to the TV is universal and easy to install. The absolute worst part is finding your stud in your wall. After you get your stud and get your deep lag screw in the center started, make sure you keep the level close. Get your second screw in and into the stud you’ve got a lot of cursing behind you. Install the third lag screw in and tighten all 3. Place cover plate and your ready to pick up that tv after having removed all cords from tv. Have a second person help visually guide you to make sure your mounting plate goes in the mount receiving hole. Secure the mounting plate to the rest of the mount with the 2 small screws. Now reconnect all wires. I like to affix a power bar or extension cord to the wall mount at this point to allow all cords to be hidden behind the tv near the middle so you have full range of motion for your tv. Using a cable management/ concealment system makes a professional looking job. Now your done. MAKE SURE TO GET THE BEST STUD FINDER YOU CAN before you start this process. Look at cable management systems as well a little homework helps make your day a lot better. This is a solid mounting system. Be warned, Many people but this system and don’t trust themselves with loosing the investment they have in there TV. I understand every second guess. I just have had good experiences with this system. The tilt and swing feature is a really nice touch. Good luck.
Works great and sturdy, but you get what you pay for in the sense that there is not much range of motion and it cannot tilt or rotate while the monitor is attached.

I want to 5 star this, but I can't. The wall mount works as described. It holds my 55" Samsung TV on the wall with no issues. My issue is with the stud screws that come with this. I didn't want to drive to Walmart again for another mount, so I bought this as it said it would be here in 2 days. Well over a week later, I finally got it and went to Walmart for grocery shopping the day before and grabbed another ONN full motion mount for the bedroom (where the Amazon one was originally intended for, not in the living room). The bolts on those are nice and thick. They feel sturdy and I am confident those will not break. These Amazon Basic ones? They're puny, the threads are bent, the bolt itself just looks thin and brittle. I still attempted putting the first one into the wall, and half way through, the bolt would not push any further, no matter what amount of strength I put into it. The bolt felt like it was bending. I went out to the hardware store and bought new ones, and they went in just fine. Not an issue at all. Nice sturdy bolts and the rest of mount went on fine with all other screws good enough for government work. I still recommend this product, maybe I got unlucky, but before you start removing your tv and furniture to get to the spot you want, make sure to double check the box and all it's contents. Make sure the bolts being used are good.

This works great with our 55" Sony TV. The mount is very strong and well designed. It mounted solidly to a stud in the wall. It doesn't make any noises when moved. The screen's range of motion makes it easy to avoid glare, and the TV can be positioned flat against the wall to take up minimal spaceOne minor issue during assembly: the mounting plate that goes on the TV is easy to install backwards... because the "UP" arrow is on the side facing the TV. Naturally, you would mount it to the set with that arrow visible; when you do, it's backwards and the TV cannot be hung on the wall mount. This cost us about five minutes, and I deducted one star from the review.
If you don’t have mounting instructions for your tv, the instructions with this bracket are lacking, in my opinion. It’s all visual. The use of the extension arms vary quite a bit.

I was nervous putting a 55inch tv on this stand but it seems to work great once installed.  Instructions are a bit confusing on attachment to tv.  Had to use trial and error to get it right for my sony.

Got this for a small 43" TV. It sits off the wall more than I thought it would. The instructions are terrible. The image you see that looks like drywall mount is actually from the directions for concrete wall. I went and got some molly bolts and used those. I'd say the biggest issue with this mount is it really doesn't have much adjustment on the wall. If you need to move up or down left or right a half inch, you can't. But it does work well. I'm happy for the price.
Buena base solo un pequeño ploblema  para hacer la función de sacarla y meterle y girarla a los lados esta muy dura se ocupa algo de fuerza y se tiene que usar las 2 manos

Ordered two TVs and two of these mounts.  One was perfect.  The other was obviously used.The screws to mount it had wallboard on them.  The mounting template was cut out and missing.  All of the parts were loose in the box.Lucky that I got two because I was able to use the other template and leftover screws to install both TVs.
Part of the mechanism that attaches from the mount to the TV wouldn’t fit.

reviewTitle: 1st day ....Lag screws broke off in wall!
reviewDescription: WELL... I was going to give this review 4 stars across the board  1) After Installing 3 of these in our house recently this last one was a doozy  2) Mounted the 55” TV like the last 3 and it started to pull out of the wall almost immediately 3) it is stud mounted as 2 of the lag screws broke off ...and are still in the wall wth 4) Very scary5) Be Aware of cheap hardware’!!

reviewTitle: Be sure of your tv mounting hole spacing.
reviewDescription: Will not work with my 25” tv. Bolt hole spacing on tv is 3 1/2”.  Smallest hole spacing on mount is 4”.

reviewTitle: Do not use with large TV’s
reviewDescription: These are super cheaply made. They would probably be fine for smaller TV’s but we tried using it with a 65” which was well under the weight limit and it bent the bracket. We were not comfortable with it and ultimately went to a local store and purchased a much heavier unit with a much larger surface area to brace against the wall. Would not recommend for large TV’s.

I used this to mount a 32'' led Visio.  The screws are either too long or too short.  The adapters are too long or two short.  The place where the TV mounts to the bracket cannot attache because the long screws wont go all the way in.  first I tried to shorten the adapters.  That's when I ran into mount issues.  So I had to go and buy shorter screws to make it work.  other than that it's fine.
Could not use it was not what it was advertised to be
Buy your own lag bolts because the ones that come with this will strip out in seconds and they don’t fit any metric or mm at all.

Would not buy again.  The level that was included was not accurate, had to use my own.  No instructions included, I figured it out.  It became apparent that the TV cannot be placed on the mount unless it is tilted as far forward as possible, but, once the TV is attached, the tilt adjusters are accessible only by the smallest hands.  I was unable to reach behind the TV to tilt the mount back to vertical and tighten the adjusters.  My wife could barely do it.

reviewTitle: Very poor design for this mounting option
reviewDescription: Exercise in frustration for smaller TVs.  The small mounting holes are impossible to use because the screw goes underneath them making it impossible to get a screwdriver inserted.  I had to try to Dremel out the metal to tighten down the screws and was still unsuccessful in being able to get a screwdriver to the top screws.  Very poor design for this mounting option.  2 stars, because the mount is decent otherwise would have been down to one.  If using the smallest mounting holes, buy something else.
Don’t recommend this to buy it to give it a second chance, there was a reason why it got returned.😅
easy install, looks and works great

reviewTitle: For a basic product this is complicated AF
reviewDescription: The instructions provided got way too much going on, not organized well. Different languages through out it instead of providing different languages separately. Not clear on what bolts and washers to use throughout the whole thing. 10/10 recommend getting something else with clearer instructions.
It would be nice if this product had directions.

I bought this to mount a 43” tv in the spare room. The holes lined up with the tv vesa mount and installation went well until I tried to install the two securing screws that keep the tv plate and the bracket arm together for safety.  The screws just would not engage in the holes. Once I took the tv back down I found that those holes were missing the all important threads. Deduction of two stars because I had to dig around in my garage to find some screws and nuts that would allow me to secure the tv plate to the bracket arm. Not sure that too many people would have these fasteners laying around. Since I had to use nuts on the tv side of the tv plate that meant that I had to attach the tv plate to the bracket arm and then enlist my wife to screw in the screws that secure the plate to the tv while I held the tv in place. Went from an easy 1 person job to a drawn out two person job.

This is a sturdy wall mount used for a Samsung smart TV. My issue is with the hardware provided. The screws supplied to attach the TV to the mount plate were either too long or not long enough. I purchased proper length M8 1.25 screws at my local hardware store. The wood bolts to attach the mount to the wall stripped easily, again I had to improvise with 1/4 inch lag screws. The mount works well just was not adequately equipped with needed or quality hardware.

Product works well I used it to mount a 32 inch flat screen, instructions were mediocre but not impossible to figure out the only thing I would add would be a bit more hardware for attaching the TV to the mount but for the price it's not a big deal

The stand itself is great - very solid, good fit and finish, tight but smooth hinges, etc. However, the instructions are absolutely horrendous. It's the usual two-pager affair with microscopic font, very complicated pictures and no real instructions per se. If you haven't set up one up, prepare to spend 20m trying to make sense of the dozens of symbolic hieroglyphs, what is meant to represent what, which part goes where, in what sequence you assemble it, etc. I know that manufacturers are going down this road to save cost (i.e. minimize paper and presumably human labor to prepare truly helpful instructions) but it is madness. And even after the 20m or more of study, prepare to make mistakes in assembly.

reviewTitle: It does the job but the instructions were not great.
reviewDescription: The product itself is what I was looking for, but it was not easy to install. The instructions are not very clear and there was some screws missing from the package. Overall, it seems like a good tv mount.

reviewTitle: Let's be clear.  It hangs the TV. It doesn't "mount" it
reviewDescription: Look, it's very economical so you need to temper expectations. It's well packed and well made and includes all the hardware you need.The TV with the hanger hooks to the wall bracket. The TV then rocks down and a small pin pops in place to "lock" Tav to the bracket. That's it. Its not really different than hanging a picture. The TV will wobble and rock around if handles. There's no feature to tighten the TV so it's immobile. It's quite free to move, but will not come off the bracket unless you pull the visible dangling rip cord to pull the lock pin.It's ok at best. Hate the movement, and loose hang. But it's cheap and puts TV on the wall.

This is a good, sturdy product.  It is very flexible.  It was received in good time and condition.  The biggest downside is that the instruction booklet is written to where you have to jump multiple pages to the next step to find it in your language, and then to realize that there are two ways to assemble was very confusing. reviewTitle: Pay attention!  Read and re-read before install, and try it out
reviewDescription: Bought to replace a heavy-duty mount for a lighter TV. Instructions are near-unintelligible; take it slow and re-“read” whatever Amazon considers “help” in their instructions before mounting. A few tips:1. Pay attention to the direction that the large mount needs to be mounted on the wall. Arrow goes “up!”  You’d think it obvious, but it isn’t and the instructions are useless with this.2. Pay attention to the sidedness of the small mount that screws onto the TV. Logo faces inwardC not outward!  The large mount will not connect with the smaller mount unless the facing is correct. Make sure there is a “space” to hook the large mount to the small mount before trying.3. Do not listen to the “eye level” instructions on the template. This assumes that your small mount is centered on the back of your TV, which is not necessarily true. See where the mounts line up and adjust as appropriate. Be careful, or you will mount your TV too high, like I did, with no way to fix the error without a complete reinstall.It’s a decent mount but this isn’t beginner-friendly despite the reviews. Extremely disappointed with the install instructions.

reviewTitle: Not very clear instructions, lots of pieces with no descriptions.
reviewDescription: EDIT:  Just saw the video on this product page with installation instructions. That would have been a lot more helpful to notice ahead of time. It is far better than the printed instructions that come with the product. Watch that first.--------I can see the frustration that some people have had with the lack of instructions. There are several different pieces in the box because this bracket is meant to be universal for several different types of TVs.  It does take a little bit of figuring out what pieces you need for your particular set up. It would be very nice if the instructions gave a brief description of what all the different pieces are for. You can see in the picture there are several screws, washers, and spacers included (even a little level which was nice!), and they are all labeled with letters.  There are no references to the letters or any of the hardware in the instructions.In addition, if you are not too handy, it is not clear what size pilot holes to drill for the bolts, or even if pilot holes are necessary.  It says to drill the bolts directly into studs and not to go into drywall, but it gives drywall anchors in the package, so it's not clear in the instructions if that really is ok or not (it's not).So if you are handy or good with tools and hardware, it may be easy to figure out. If you bought a TV and simply want to mount it to your wall and you are not comfortable with basic tools, it will be confusing. Get some help.

reviewTitle: Far too Heavy for Smaller Television LCD/LED Displays!
reviewDescription: This mount is far too heavy for televisions weighing only 10 pounds or less, with the amount of metal/steel used for the mount being wasted and/or not utilized!I returned this make/model, and purchased a TV display mount weighing the typical three pounds.However, this mount might be just fine for larger more heavier TV displays.  Although the nomenclature states the mount could be used for smaller TV displays, I just would not recommend it.

reviewTitle: It's a great mount for a lightweight LED TV. (However, don't trust the built-in level)
reviewDescription: It's a great mount for a lightweight LED TV and a great mount at it's price point.  I have deducted 2 stars for the following reasons:Compared to previous mounts I have purchased, this one by no means is "Heavy-Duty".  The metal flexes a little under torque.  It's fine for a modern lightweight TV, but I would not recommend this mount to hang a heavy plasma or older LCD TV.  The heavy duty mounts I have used in the past are much thicker metal and have zero flex to them.  (Minus 1 star for claiming to be heavy duty when its really not.)The built in bubble level on the wall mount is garbage.  I should have read the other reviews here first that clearly point this flaw out.  I made the mistake of installing the wall bracket and trusting in the built in bubble level (how can you screw up a bubble level?).  When I went to hang the TV it was close to 2 inches too high on one side compared to the other.  After taking back down the TV and putting a proper level on top of the wall bracket the problem was obvious.  The built in bubble level was way off.  I would have much preferred this mount to not include a level at all if its going to be inaccurate.  I have included a photo of the built in bubble level compared to a separate level after re-leveling the bracket according to the tool.  (Minus 1 star for misleading, inaccurate, useless bubble level)In summary, its a fine mount at a very affordable price point as long as you are aware of the downsides up front.  I would have given this mount 5 stars if it had not claimed to be heavy-duty and had not included a built in level or included a built in level that was accurate.

reviewTitle: Providing measurement for the full-motion 22-25 inch version.
reviewDescription: I have not installed and used the product. I will return because I’m looking for a mount that will have the TV roughly centered on a wall with a non-center stud. I want to provide a couple measurements that may help others.  The current answers are all over the place, both because they don’t specify which model and because I think the design has changed over the years. I have the 22-55 inch full motion model with ASIN B01KBEOL5E, Jan 2023.  When fully collapsed against the wall, the bracket that attaches to the Tv is exactly centered (0 offset) over the stud-mounting bracket. So if your stud is off-center, the TV will also be off-center when collapsed against wall. If you push the TV against the wall when the arm is fully extended, there is an offset of 13.75 inches between stud bracket center and TV center bracket center. The base plate that mounts to wall is roughly 11.5 inches tall by 3.25 inches wide by .25 inches deep. The screw holes are are 9.25 inches apart vertically.  The distance between the wall and the plate that mounts to TV is 15.25 inches when fully extended. Amazon is not letting me post pics. I think all mounts should include these measurements as part of specs, so we know where TV will end up on wall (not all are centered over stud plate).

The template provided for this is inaccurate to the actual product. Make sure to use your actual mount as the guide. They could improve this product by simply NOT INCLUDING the misleading paper they provided.

Purchased this mount for an older model TV that measures 55" in width.  Installation was pretty straight forward.  The template supplied made it easy to figure out where to drill the holes.  One drawback is that there isn't much room for side-to-side adjustment.  The mount is designed to be drilled into studs with 16" centers, although there's a second set of holes set a few inches closer together.  Once the mount is secured to the wall, it's possible to hang the TV off center a little bit (maybe 6" in either direction of center).The TV can be adjusted front-to-back tilt, as well as horizontal tilt, but it takes some effort.  Front-to-back tilt is controlled by loosening a set of screws with the supplied allen key, moving the TV to the desired tilt, and then tightening them.  I found that I had to really torque these down tight to ensure that my 80lb TV didn't continue to tilt forward.  There's not a lot of room to turn the allen wrench, although fully extending the TV and turning it to one side did move the brackets out of the way to give some room to turn the wrench.For the horizontal tilt, there are 2 bolts with Phillips head screws that need to be tightened.  Again, its a matter of positioning the TV to level, and then tightening the bolts.  I found that I couldn't get enough torque using a screwdriver, but a socket wrench (metric size) did the trick.  I did notice that although the TV was adjusted to be horizontally level when up against the wall, it was a little off level when fully extended and turned.With my 55" wide TV, I'm able to rotate the TV about 60 or 70 degrees from the wall.  Not the 90 degrees I was expecting, but it's good enough for my application.UPDATE:  After using this mount for a month or so, I've had to re-tighten the screws that set the vertical tilt two times.  I have my TV mounted outside, and I need to pull it away from the wall and rotate it every time I use it.  The act of moving it around seems to loosen the tilt adjustment screws.  I'm going to wedge something into the slots to ensure that it doesn't tilt forward anymore, but I feel like this is a design flaw, and I've reduced my rating by 1-star because of this.

Has held up my giant 55 inch tv for 3 months now. 10/10 would buy again

Very solid and good quality.Instructions are easy to understand - a one person job for even the person who is only "slightly" handy.It comes with screws and extensions to fit just about any TVs back plate. Very well thought out product.I attached a 43" TV to it in our guest room and it was great getting it off the "stand" I had bought only to find out that it was too short.If I had the need, I would buy another.The Bottom Line?Uncle Steve Approved!
I actually bought this to mount a tool box in my truck so that I could swivel it in out over my tailgate. Well built and very stout! Shouldn’t have any issues holding a tv.

Sturdy build, no problem handling my 11 year old plasma TV. Instructions aren't the clearest I've ever seen but they worked. Also used Echogear low voltage kit for in wall use for the plug so no wires hanging down, love it.
Commercial stuff

The installation process was straightforward and hassle-free. The instructions were clear, and all necessary hardware was included, making it easy even for someone with minimal DIY experience.Moving the TV is a breeze. The articulating arm allows for effortless adjustments, making it simple to find the perfect viewing angle. Whether I want to tilt, swivel, or extend the TV, it moves smoothly and stays in place once adjusted.The price point is fantastic for the quality and functionality offered. It’s a budget-friendly option that doesn’t compromise on performance or durability.

reviewTitle: Can't manage as much size or weight as it claims to- and hard to center on a wall
reviewDescription: Just switched to a larger TV, but still well within the mount's advertised size range.
