On three occasions now, the hinge screws that allow you to adjust the angle of the TV (I.e if you wanted to tilt it down,) have just released and allowed the TV to pivot so that the bottom moves closer to the wall and the top tilts away from the wall.  I've given up and just decided to allow it to stay that way, because my nerves can't take a huge TV suddenly lunging towards me as I sit at my desk again.The other issue is that with the size/shape of the wall bracket, you'll be very lucky if you happen to have a stud in the exact spot where the mount needs to go in order to screw into a stud.  I'd opt for one of the mounts with wide horizontal brackets in the future, as those would allow you to shift the TV left/right in order to center it.

The mount is nice, however the screws are weak (see pictures) and the holes were not fitting the screws 😫. Same issues with the screws that go into the wall stud; because of that, we couldn't put them all the way in the stud, afraid we won't be able to take them out when needed, and the cover therefore didn't close.

There’s no way to screw in the wing arms to tv attachment. Its a lot of screws and washers but does nothing to help build what it is showing. I am having to go to a local hardware store to find nuts and bolts to create item. Headache- beware
Sanus mounts are so much easier.

reviewTitle: if the no beam to hold the tv mount isn't working 😒
reviewDescription: After installation the mount came off the wall so if you don't have a good support isn't going to be able to used it.

reviewTitle: Wish this mount was flexible and universal
reviewDescription: Make sure to check your studs before buying this. This mount was recommended for me for my 77” LG C1 tv. I bought it back at December and just started the process to mount it. After measuring my studs, i lay over the traced mount paper that was provided to the wall. I didn’t realize this supported only 16” studs. The studs in my living room are 20” inches. I didn’t realize my previous mount for my older tv was a universal one, so the thought about different widths of stud didn’t crossed my mind.I do wish this stud was universal and adjustable

reviewTitle: After you figure out how to install it it is a good deal
reviewDescription: I got this for my daughters room - it came with ZERO instructions on how to install so you have to go on youtube to figure it out.  We had to take everything apart and start over because one small step ruined the entire install.  In the end it is solid and seems to work really well.  The price is amazing so I can't be too annoyed with the lack of direction.

reviewTitle: Missing correct hardware, bolts break in wood studs.
reviewDescription: If I could give -1 star I would(joking, that repetitive comment) 3 stars. Solid, nice range of motion. Buuuuuut. The included bolts were about 1/16-2/16 in short. Very frustrating. I had to make a trip and find a 5/16 x 2 machined bolt to get the mount to fit to a Samsung vesa 400x400. Mind you this is Samsung probably the biggest manufacturer of Displays in the world. So they screwed up on the mounting hardware options. Got around that. The mount is nice. Make sure you have a good stud finder, drill. After the wrong bolt debacle got it mounted and TV up. Feels very sturdy and nice range of motion.-update, first one had wrong size bolts that wouldn’t fit my new Samsung 400x400 vesa, the bolts were not long enough by 1/4”. The second mount 2 bolts broke when mounting. The mount itself is good. The pack in bolts and hardware is pure JUNK!
Came with a decective wrench, I will have to go to home Depot for buying a wrench now

reviewTitle: Poor Design for Tilting TV Mount
reviewDescription: It is a poor design for a "tilting" wall mount. Each arm that supports the TV has a nob to turn that allows you to adjust it. But when the TV is vertically it is practically impossible to access it by hand and you need a extended screwdriver (16" extra for 55" TV). When it is vertical or even semi-vertical it is, once again, practically impossible to plug in cables. To be clear it will tilt it just requires tools and a small hand.We are returning this as soon as our new one arrives. This model while twice the cost allows you to tilt by simple pushing the TV forward. No tools or having to unscrew and re-screw every time.https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00BMGTALQ/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1I'm a big fan of AmazonBasics but they really missed the mark here. I made the mistake of trusting that it had so many great reviews without reading the negative reviews.This post is under my wife's account but the husband of this account bought and is returning this product.

reviewTitle: Buyer beware!!! Head of the included M4 screws (VESA 100x100 TVs) smaller than the holes in included washer and back plate.
reviewDescription: Buyer beware. Both sets of the 4 included M4 screws (needed for VESA 100 mm by 100 mm TVs) included with the kit have a head smaller than the holes in the included washer and the back plate . You cannot use those screws as the back plate will not attach to the TV. I used my own Stainless Steel Fender Washer, 1/8 in X 1 in and the 4 of the included M4 X 12mm screws to attach the back plate to the TV. I had to cut the washers to size and was more work than I planned for. After that was done all other tasks were simple. Just wanted to give fair warning to anyone else buying this kit as this will cause your TV to fall if you attach with or without the washers. The spacers were good but the design recommends using the spacer with the washer and as before the washer would not work with the included screws.

I bought this for my 50” tv, thinking it would suffice despite being on the larger side of the spectrum. When I unboxed it, I realized it was a single arm mount, and would likely not hold my 2-man lift 50” tv. I expect it would probably work fine for a significantly newer (and therefore lighter) tv, but if it appears to be a heavy tv you couldn’t lift yourself, I’d not trust the mount to hold yours indefinitely. Better to get a double arm design.

reviewTitle: Level on Wall Bracket Not Accurate
reviewDescription: It's a TV mount, so not much to review. Very easy to setup, seems like heavy quality steel for the brackets, and comes with all the hardware+ for mounting to different TV types. Only complaint is the integrated bubble level on the wall bracket....which is way off. I marked the holes keeping level with the integrated bubble, hammer drilled pilot holes thru brick, mounted the wall bracket with Tapcons, and then hung the TV to find out the dang thing wasn't close to level. So I took it all back down and remounted using my own level to finally get it level. Wasted about an hour of time to get it right. So make sure to use your own level, don't trust the one that is on the bracket. The picture shows how off the level on the wall bracket is when I actually got it level.

reviewTitle: Disappointed This Mount Does Not Flush With Wall
reviewDescription: If you are looking for a TV wall mount that aligns & flushes back into your wall perfectly in the middle, this is NOT the model for you. I just recently got this mount installed onto my wall here in my studio apartment, and the results of how it turned out after the time and money I spent into it have me very underwhelmed. While the quality and material are good, I'm just upset that when it comes time to push my TV back into the wall, it does not do perfectly in the middle and instead goes more to the left. Overall, just very displeased with this product for the type of wall mount I needed and in the future plan to look more a model that is more flush to the wall for my purposes.

reviewTitle: One evening later, still not done.
reviewDescription: Solid looking product, the installation template is nice. That's where my good impression ends.Instruction booklet would have been better off with different languages in separate sections, instead of each page having instructions in all 6 languages. Instructions are convoluted, way too many extra parts included, with unhelpful letter labels.Drilling has been a nightmare so far. We've increased the size of the holes 2 times already and still these giant screws are too big to fit in! Any deeper and we'll drill a hole right out of our house at this rate! I understand things need to be safely mounted but 2.5 inches is a long way to drill in!We've called it quits for one night, maybe sometime tomorrow we can get a new set of not stupid screws and try again...
This mount is so heavy, I needed a helper just to mount it.  And the price is a little too high.  It actually weighs more than the TV.  Returned for a lighter, less expensive unit.

The instructions for using this wall mount where so confusing and difficult to follow! This is probably the 4th or 5th time I've mounted a tv and never had any issues before. I will never use this mount again. I was finally able to mount my tv, but I don't think I did it correctly so hopefully it doesn't fall down.

reviewTitle: To many parts and screws, bolts its absurd , compared to other mount this 100 time more complicated
reviewDescription: I have another wall mount for a bigger TV, it has two wall bolts and 4 screws to attach the TVThis mount has over 50 little screws and bolts and washers, i have not nearly completed it even though I mounted the bracket on et wall. This is today's nightmare.Had i known i would have have returned it I would still like to

I had this mount installed professionally and the 75" LG TV sat straight.  It is mounted in a built in wall unit and we needed to get behind the TV easily.  After about a month or so the TV started to tilt down.  Considering we sit across from the TV at eye level, this was not good.  I had a local handyman come in and level it.  It is now sagging again.I would not order this product again and I hope the manufacturer reads this and contacts me we a solution before we have to go out and replace it.

reviewTitle: Need longer M8 screws for Samsung
reviewDescription: Two issues:1.Samsung TVs need M8 43mm - 45mm screws to attach plate with Samsung’s spacers that came with tv. Spacers that come with bracket are too fat for Samsung and too short. Bought M8 45mm screws at Home Depot.2. The security screws (FS) which are also the leveling screws are brittle. I hand tighten one and the head popped off. I had to struggle to drill out the remaining screw but the threads were damaged. I managed to utilize one of the extra M4 screws and found a sweet spot where it grabbed but if go to far it loses it bite.Other than that it’s ok and does the job. Hoping Amazon sends me a new plate and leveling screws.

reviewTitle: Please read, might save you the trouble
reviewDescription: The product itself seems to be built well and of good quality, however we purchased a Vizio 24 inch TV that I double checked on the sizing to ensure it would fit the bracket that screws to the back of the TV and found that it completely covers all of the HDMI ports AND the power cord input. Even after trying to rig it with the spacers that were provided we were still unable to make this work. We ended up having to go up in size to a 32" which worked great. I just felt frustrated though because we checked the sizing and everything prior so this put us at driving an extra hour just to go make the return of our TV because it was either that or return this mount which had already been drilled into our wall and would have resulted in more work to patch the enormous holes.Best advice: check power cord input and HDMI to make sure that they aren't covered by backplate of mount prior!!

The drywall mounts are not strong enough they are a very weak material and the shape isn't correct to hold. We hammered in the drywall mount... no problem but then when we went to screw the screw in the whole drywall mount pushed all the way through and we heard it drop down between the walls 😅. Soooo we got another mount and went with that

reviewTitle: Works fine for the price. Very heavy and a little unclear
reviewDescription: The instructions were literally “all over the place”. Some were on the template, some in the English section if the manual and some at the back illustrations. Still failed to clearly note a few things:1. The plastic facade the goes against the wall mount has no  connection and just floats there. (See photos)2. The tv plate can be removed but this is not clear unless you stare at all the illustrations. I first thought i had to hold the TV while i lined up the screw holes and held the screwdriver.3. The screws and washers that came with it were not referenced anywhere. I ended up using A and R4. The instructions said to refer to your tv for mounting instructions. Tv did not come with this.Note: I bought this mount with a combo TV order in Amazon. You would think they'd be synchronous instructions but they were not. Still worked fine in the end but I am a visual/technical minded gal.
The instructions were just pictures.

The tilt is designed to be adjusted by  a bolt in an oval slot.  The bolt is threaded into an opposite piece. I was never able to tighten the bolt to the point where it wouldn't slip forward under the weight of the TV. There need to be some washers or other gripping pieces to stop the tilt section from tilting forward under weight.

reviewTitle: Don't trust the built in level
reviewDescription: I gave this 3 stars because the built in level is way off as you can see in my picture.  If I was going to level from the build in level the wall mount would have been crooked.  I always verify with a level I know is true.A person who doesn't have the right tools would install this wrong because of the level being off.I'm happy with the quality otherwise. The arms take little effort to move.It also came with a template which did help for the install.I used this on a Sony a80j OLED 65 inch

The product itself seems to be very durable and functional but the instructions that come with it leave a ton to be desired. Being a mount that’s “universal” leaves a lot of unused hardware and there are no words in the instructions just diagrams. Leaves you to use your imagination quite a bit, just awful instructions.

I've mounted several TVs with several different types of mounts and this mount is my least favorite of them all. It works just fine and is perfectly safe, sturdy, and functional. However, it is harder to mount than other types. First, the entire mount system has to be held up against the wall while you're mounting. You cannot just mount a plate or something and then attach the mount. You have to hold up the entire thing. Secondly, because of the first issue, it is EXTREMELY hard to mount perfectly level by yourself. This is further complicated by the fact that the part that actually affixes to the wall is relatively thin. If you are trying to hold it up against a level or level line you've marked on the wall, it is very hard to keep stationary.  All that said, after wrestling with this thing for longer than I care to admit, the TV is mounted, it does look nice, and it is perfectly functional as advertised.

reviewTitle: it was easy to install and is holding the TV up without ...
reviewDescription: Somehow the level in this mount is not correct. We used the built-in level and when we installed the television it was not actually level. I'm not even sure how that is possible, so make sure you check and double check the installation with a different level while putting it on the wall.Other than that, it was easy to install and is holding the TV up without an issue. I wish it were about 2" longer, as the way the studs in our wall are arranged the TV is off center on the wall, but that's no the fault of this mount. The mounting hardware provides a lot of flexibility so if you have a weird TV or it has recessed or uneven holes you can easily install the brackets on the back. The included guide that shows where the center line of the TV will be was extremely useful for figuring out where to put it on the wall.Overall, besides the leveling issue, a good purchase. Double check the level with a separate level and you'll be very pleased.

reviewTitle: functional, but made from cheap, low-grade parts. also, no useful assembly instructions.
reviewDescription: If you are going to hang the TV once and never move it again, this is probably a safe buy.  The TV mounted brackets are the thinnest gauge metal I've ever seen on a TV mount, but engineered in a way that it is sturdy enough.  The friction mechanism to hold the preferred tilt of the TV is cheap plastic, and will not likely survive multiple adjustments (It feels like it would be easy to strip the threads if over-tightened).  Also, the built-in bubble level in the center of the wall bracket is a great idea, but only if it is actually square with the bracket.  Mine was glued on crooked, so it was useless.  You should plan on using a real level when you install this product.All that said, It was easy to install.  It came with a wide variety of different size bolts and spacers - but no instructions about how various parts should be assembled.  If you are used to DIY assembly, it is easy to figure out though.
Easy fast sturdy install less then 30 minutes to install including mounting TV and arguing with my son.

got this for a roku TV, it had initially confusing directions when it came to figuring out what hardware needed to he used (I may be stupid) but it was easy to install once my brain cells did their thing. very durable, the arm moves smoothly, and the stand itself isn't fugly so that's a win too

reviewTitle: Our tv is up and away from the kids
reviewDescription: I love this ! I can watch tv at any angle ! Sun I’m coming for you !
Came with all the parts. Setup was pretty easy. Glad it included a level.
Love how solid it is and also easy to move
Very strong mount. Easy to install. I would strongly recommend this product.
Easy to install
Works very well
Very easy to install. Easy movement. Lots of range.
It works perfect

So the instructions in the packet didn’t make sense, so we ended up figuring out another way to put it together and it’s been holding our 55 inch TV up really well since! But again the instruction manual is terrible.

reviewTitle: Good quality & easy install - only lacking range of motion
reviewDescription: It's sturdy and well-constructed, ensuring a secure hold for my TV. However, the only area that could be improved is the range of motion in terms of how far the TV can be turned. While it's a minor limitation, the mount's inability to swivel or tilt as much as expected might be a drawback for those seeking more adjustability. Overall, it's a reliable and durable mount that secures the TV well, but it could benefit from greater flexibility in movement.
Nothing fancy but did not expect fancy:  it works!
Great Wall mount but the directions are ridiculous I’m handy but your on your own  it’s a simple project but takes longer than it should because of worthless diagrams and no wording
Works fine but instructions could be clearer....

Overall very sturdy and easy to install. the only improvement I would like to see is that it comes off the wall a bit farther than aesthetically pleasing resulting in a sizable visible gap (bit over 2") between the TV and the wall.

This wall mount is well designed and fairly easy to install. The one deviation from the instructions I made was in the size of my drill bit. The 5/32 recommended in the instructions was too small for the screws provided especially for a woman with a less than powerful drill. I took one star off for the fact that the instructions were entirely visual. Watching the video and a YouTube video on how to locate studs was  ery helpful.
The job and enjoying the movement

reviewTitle: Solid mount but a little loose
reviewDescription: The mounting solution for this is good on both ends. My big complaint is that the joints are a little loose and allow a very slight sag. Not a huge issue to fix with washers on the wall end but could be better. Not bad for the price. To clarify, I have a 22" monitor on this so the sag might be more noticable with a larger monitor. Second photo shows where I added a few washers.
I worked for me and easy to use/install.
easy to use. good quality
Buena calidad
Everything provided allowed quick installation. All I had to do was drill holes. The hardware was sufficient complete uncomplicated placement.
Perfect
This mount was easy to assemble and attach to my TV.  I didn't need the extension pieces for my TV.
Easy to follow instructions, and got it up and installed quickly to a small TV.

The Amazon Basics Full Motion Articulating TV Monitor Wall Mount is easy to install and comes with everything you need including a level. I just installed it outside on the patio for my new tv and it was easy and took less than 15 minutes. I can position the tv any which way so it can be viewed from any part of the patio or in the pool.
We really appreciated the videos that are available on Amazon for this product, very helpful with the installation.

Received a quote from handy man to install.  After install was done he revised his quote stating "that was really easy to install", so he charged me a lower fee to install.  Very sturdy, I would highly recommend this product.
A little difficult to install, but once in place is great. Very satisfied with my purchase.

No way does this hold the advertised weight. I tried mounting an older 55" & 100lb plasma TV and the bars that hold the vesa mount bent. The mount itself its sturdy and well built but strength fails at the vesa mount.

reviewTitle: Can’t fit hand between wall and tv to adjust.
reviewDescription: Very hard to engage hooks, can’t fit hand behind to adjust angle. After wrestling it’s finally up. Would not buy again.

reviewTitle: Bars will not fit TV sizes listed
reviewDescription: The mounting brackets on this are very short and will not reach the holes in the back of a 43 inch TV as listed in the description without purchasing extenders.

Very cheaply made. The lag bolts are aluminum and parts of the threads are missing and the heads strip easily. The back of the wall mounting plate will chew up your wall as the 'pads' are recessed from the curved/sharp metal edges.The dovetail for mounting the TV is far too narrow, which makes for a very risky mount. It's too easy for it to sit wrong, leading to your TV face planting. The set screws for setting tv tilt are awkward since you need access from both sides of the TVs to tighten or loosen them.
This was very difficult to put together.  The directions were terrible.  They only show pictures no written directions.

The design is fine, but the screws were poor quality - they had a hard time digging into the wood studs and just stripped instead. Even if you manage to get them in the wall, you'd never get them out.I'd recommend not buying this; get something higher-quality.

reviewTitle: Not the best… tv moves too much once it is on the wall. Not very sturdy.
reviewDescription: Easy to install, but it does not hold the tv in place very well. It can easily move on the mount… always stays tilted no matterHow tight the screws are… and I have a very light tv, about 7lbs

We were very impressed with the quality of the TV mount, It is a heavy duty one  But when we attempted to mount our 24" smart TV to the plate we encountered a problem.  The screw holes matched up with the back of our TV just fine, but the plate was too large and covered the port on the back of the TV where the power cord for the TV needs to be plugged in.  So we had to order a different wall mount.
I bought this item to use on a Sony 46 inch  Bravia TV but it CANNOT work on this TVThis bracket covers / blocks out ALL the input points eg. Antennae, Internet, etc. etc.

I bought 2 of these mount for 2 Vizios i believe they are 27" or right around that. Unfortunately when I put the mount on the TV it covers over half of the plugs on the back of the TV and those have no side connections. You are unable to connect ethernet, or either HDMI on the models I have.  I was able to cut a piece off the mount to fix the problem, but it would have been better if I didnt have to do that.

I gave this only a two star rating because the lag bolts included and instructions are the worst. The lag bolts were so bad they snapped during installation and the instructions lacked in instruction. However, the articulating mount is very nice and worth the price but go and buy new lag bolts at the hardware store before you install this mount to save yourself a massive headache.
Part of frame was supposed to have threads for bolts and did not.

reviewTitle: Will not work on Vizio 32” D series Tv
reviewDescription: I can’t say much about the performance of the puduct because I was not able to install it. The mounting plate that installs onto the back of the TV is too big and blocks the power port on the back of the tv. It hangs over the VESA mounting homes and into the media input section on the back of the tv.

reviewTitle: READ BEFORE BUYING: we've installed 4 previously, this time impossible,
reviewDescription: OVERALL GREAT VALUE, not recommended for anything above 47 inches. Doesn't fit LG 55 inch TV, absolutely no way to attach to the 300MM X 300MMVery frustrating experience wasted a good 90 minutes.  Was super easy and works well on smaller tv's and on our VIZIO, even installed on a 55 inch VIZIO

While my tv fits on the mount, the level on the wall mount it self was off from another level we had laying around the house. So we went with the wall mount level and the tv was crooked, had to redo the whole process 3 times. Come to find out that the bottom latches don't even latch onto the wall mount. Currently in the process of looking for a new wall mount.

One of the four extended arms was not machined correctly so the screw did not attach. Had to order a second one for parts because I had already put the unit on the wall and was not going to take it down to hassle with a return

reviewTitle: Does not maintain a level postion from open to close
reviewDescription: I leveled the mount when closed, but after opening it to an angled position, the TV is no longer level.  I had to level it at the opened position, and then put up with it looking crooked on my bedroom wall when not in use.  Poor design...

reviewTitle: Bad bolts shear off!  Be careful!
reviewDescription: Would be 5 star if the super cheap bolts didn’t shear off in the stud.  I ended up with two sheared off bolts that were tightened by hand.  Dangerous product without buying aftermarket bolts from Home Depot etc... I’m confident it’s sturdy now but if you buy do NOT use their bolts!
Super cheap and it wobbles with the tv on it, mounting system just isn't tight

I do like this style of T.v. mount. I give it 2 stars because it is impossible to get LEVEL !! If you pull it out from the wall and level it, the. Push it back against the wall it is out of level. Same thing vice versa. Also if you bend it the opposite way it will be out of level. So the concept of the T.v mount is useless !!
It’s doing the job but would have liked it to be a bit more sturdy.
Easy enough to assemble. Just make it's used on a light weight led TV. Lcd might be too heavy

reviewTitle: Bring your patients and then some
reviewDescription: I attempted to assemble and attach this thing to my tv and then walked away from it 3x before having any success. Then after you manage that part make sure to brush up on your trigonometry because if you just center the piece that attaches to the wall to tv itself will not in fact be centered. However if you get past the assemble and you can center everything around the tv (instead of centering the tv to everything else) then it's sturdy and so easy to put the tv at any angle you want.

reviewTitle: Nice but heavy realized can’t hang on wall, my walls are week. Heavier than tv
reviewDescription: Nice but heavy realized can’t hang on wall, my walls are week. Heavier than tv

Very sturdy and easy to adjust. We mounted on back porch and the only reason it gets 4 star and not 5 is cover plate that covers mounting bolts will not snap on because of our vinyl siding. Not a big issue for us for tv covers it anyway.
Was not what I thought it was but it worked for now
hex bolts are soft metal and are easily stripped. Also, they are metric so be sure you have a 10mm socket of some sort.
1. The only set of screws and washers that fit and tighten the TV to the bracket were a 1 CM too long. There's a wobble now. They also shred easy.

reviewTitle: Was a little difficult to mount from a high location with a 32" TV.
reviewDescription: A little difficult to get the spacing correct with the VESA mount on my TV. Likely a non-standard mount. It worked okay, but a little difficult. Price was right and working well once it was mounted.

We replaced our old RV TV with a smart TV and the existing mount did not match. This mount advertised almost 100% compatibility and they were not wrong. So many accessories to accommodate any TV manufacturer. There were several parts supplied that were not needed, but it was clear there was an incredible range of variations for attaching to the TV>

reviewTitle: The bars stick out from below the Fire TV Omni 55
reviewDescription: The mount itself works exactly as described - full motion. The installation process was easy with a template and clear instructions. The only reason I took out 2 stars is because this does not work well for the Fire TV Omni series 55 inch.The bars stick out from below the TV: You can see that the bars on the mount look like an X. On a Fire TV Omni 55, the mounting is done at the lower end of the TV. The net result is that the 2 bottom parts of the X project out below the TV and are visible from the front. This was not a dealbreaker for me since I was looking at a mounting in the garage, and so I did not want to go through the hassle of waiting for a new mount to come back.
Nice solid product.  The directions not exactly good or easy to follow

reviewTitle: It works but it’s really confusing
reviewDescription: I was building it and the instruction were so confusing no words and there’s so many screws. But it works good holds my tv well

reviewTitle: It is NOT off center (and I wanted it to be)
reviewDescription: I bought this specifically because a number of reviewers complained about it being off center by 4 inches when mounted and pushed back flat against the wall.  Unfortunately this mounting bracket is perfectly centered.

reviewTitle: Some screws are missing but other than that is fine
reviewDescription: Two screws using at the very final step were missing. We were lazy to put everything back for a return or replacement so ending up buying compatible screws in Home Depot. The product works fine and flexible with different angle, but highly suggest to check every part before the installation.

reviewTitle: Works, but the screws broke during install.
reviewDescription: One of the screw heads broke off as I was mounting it to the wall. Aside from that, it's still pretty stable and was relatively easy to install.

reviewTitle: Mount is great; hardware not so much.
reviewDescription: Opening the box I thought the product was very well made.Instructions are useless for the most part.The hardware that mounts to the TV is fine however the bolts provided to secure the mount to the wall are cheap quality. Unfortunately had one of the bolts snap on me while installing (wasn’t over tightened still have some space to go before the but was fully flush with the bracket). Thankfully I was able to secure the bracket with the two other mount holes in the bracket.

Make sure your tv supports the M4,M6, and M8 Screws for bracket mounting, my tv needed M5 screws and it didnt come with them. had to go to walmart and get a hardware kit for the screws. and Upsize the drill bit when drilling the holes in your studs by atleast 2 sizes, used the reccommended size, (5/32) and stripped the screws trying to put them in because the holes were much smaller than they shouldve

It fits the TV and mounts it to the wall.  So far it appears to be ok.  The included hardware works well.  The wall bracket should have been made out of a thicker metal.  Since you stud mount this, and its only so long you can't center mount the TV on the bracket (IRT to anchor points) to distribute weight on it.  This causes one of the sides to be extended beyond the wall stud anchor point, and with the TV weight on that side it slightly bends the bracket away from the wall.  My TV is well within the weight specs that is claimed.  The release cords for the mount are very long and require a little looping and tucking to hide them behind the mount.  As others have noted the "level" on the wall bracket is off, its useless.  If you don't have a level it will get you as close to level as eyeballing it will.  Thing I learned very quickly was how much of a difference my other mounts with extension capability makes so that you can pull the TV from the wall a few inches.  This mount, have two or three people to install the TV, one or two to hold it up and one to hook up the cables before you put it on the wall.  For the price though it is serving its purpose.  Tilt is very very minute because it is so close to the wall.

I guess since this is a universal tv wall mount, the instructions were extremely difficult to follow. It’s very sturdy and final product is great, but would def recommend buying one specific for your tv/size next time
No complaints at this time

This tv mount was very easy to mount, it performs just as much as I need it to! You can move the tv to any angle you desire. It’s very sturdy when moving. There are lots of screws so make sure you follow instructions!

reviewTitle: Works well at a fraction of the cost
reviewDescription: Got one for $100 at Best Buy and this for $25. This works just the same, fully mobile and holds my 55 inch. Save your money get this
Easy to install. Brings all hardware needed for different size TVs.  Great movement accommodates many angles. Brings screws and spacers. I highly recommend it.

reviewTitle: Heavy, but easy to install all the same
reviewDescription: The second this super-heavy box arrived on my doorstep I panicked a bit - would this actually work for my TV? It definitely did and was quite easy to install.Worth noting that while the instructions (which are all picture, if I recall correctly) don't show all the permutations of the way you can configure the part that attaches to your TV, but I found a setup that works really well for the Toshiba FireTV I bought recently. This package comes with a paper guide to help you place your initial mount (don't make my mistake, though: make sure you or someone else eyeballs the TV placement *from the distance you'll be sitting to view* so you have it at a good height - mine's a wee bit higher than I would like, but I angled the TV to offset).I also appreciate it that it comes with a level. If you're a perfectionist like me, you will absolutely notice if your TV isn't 100% level and it'll drive you bonkers. But the good news is, even if you initially don't get your TV exactly as you want - it's pretty easy to make a minor adjustment.This was a two person job but the second person really just needed to hold the TV in place a couple times. It's very easy to tilt your TV with the device it comes with, so I have my TV tilted down ever so slightly. It's also easy to move the arm around. It also comes with a small clip to help you arrange your cords so they're not dangling all over the place. Very good value for what you pay and easy to get going. I thought it'd be a half day project, but we had my new TV up and mounted in less than an hour no problem.
Wonderful to have my TV hung now!

reviewTitle: Good product, very versatile, but you have to follow the directions.
reviewDescription: Since this product is so versatile you have to make sure you follow the directions for your specific TV and don’t skip any steps.

reviewTitle: Works really well for my 42 to 50 inch TV's.
reviewDescription: The mount will accommodate several sizes. I have two 42 inch and one 50 inch TV mounted on three of these around the house. It's really easy to assemble and it's very sturdy. It can be articulated to adapt to most any angle needed for home viewing. It comes with hardware to adapt to most situations that you would encounter with wall mounting in a home. Very happy with it. Definitely recommend it.

I have a new 75" TV and this mount it is SO MUCH BETTER than using the stands.  Need to plug in cables? No big deal just pull out the TV from the wall and you have all the room you need. Tilt and viewing angles easily adjustable and stay put depending on how tight the set screws are set. Obvious install issue, is to tap into your wall studs as a 100 lb+ TV plus the HD mount is serious weight, especially when extended. Only gripe is 1 day after I received this, Amazon decided to discount the unit by 20%...hummm not the first time to experience this with previous purchased. Seems a bit fishy (AI?), to put it nicely. Notwithstanding a good unit.

This is a great mounting bracket for our old 45 inch smart TV. We used it to hang our 12 year old smart TV that we still have for the kids. It is heavy, but this mounting bracket is holding it up and we are able to fully move it different ways with ease! It was very easy to install since it is a single line bracket. You just need to find the stud and drill in the screws from there. It is nice also that it includes extensions to attach the bracket to the TV. Most newer TV's have the holes in the same spot, but not all the old ones.It is a great bracket that we will be buying again, if we have another TV that fits the size.

reviewTitle: Great mount but installation can be tricky
reviewDescription: Great mount but the screws (for the wall and hanging) strip easily. So beware.

This mount is really great! It’s store easy to install & holds a lot of weight. But, the dials to adjust the TV up/down angle are too close to the TV so I can’t tighten them. & maybe that’s more of a TV problem, but either way I just have a piece of wood wedged behind the TV that you can’t see to hold its angle. The easy install was far more important to me. I would definitely recommend.

Was not aware when purchased that it was not going to be easy to adapt to back of my 32 inch  fireTV, to wall mount.  There was only one option and the fit was tight and awkward. I made it work, but it required a trip to hardware store. It’s not perfect but functional. How was I to know it wasn’t going to work easily with my 32 inch TV? Mlc

reviewTitle: Be prepared to buy your own screws!!
reviewDescription: This is a great wall mount BUT when I tried to install the backplate onto my Samsung 43" TV, none of the screws provided fit the holes on the back of the Samsung 43" TV. One set was too long and the other set was too short. The instructions indicate that three lengths are provided but they are not. They aren't even on the included supply list. Easy to fix with a quick trip to Lowe's but I should not have had to do that. It is possible other TV brands would accept the two screw lengths provided, but Samsung 43" is a definite no. And the Samsung 43" is brand new model and not an older one.

Because of the poor instructions that came with the unit, I had to hire a professional installer to the wall mount up on the wall.  You receive all the parts and pieces in individual cellophane packets, but unlabeled for what each contains.

Overall a great value. Well made, beefy. Will support a 55 inch TV. Mine was a wee 40 incher @ 16 lbs. Requires thoughtful planning before execution. Most important is the location and method of securing to wall. Mount comes with a wide variety of fasteners and spacers. Be careful when mounting the VESA base plate to your TV. The length of the screws vs the TV mounting hole depth is critical to prevent damage to TV. If needed use the supplied spacers. Too long and !#x$*&! In my case the TV manual said I needed a 6mm screw (supplied in the kit). In reality though my TV required a 5mm screw. Plan ahead. Most of the mounting work can be done by 1 person. The final step of lifting and securing the tv to the mount is definitely a 2 person job!

This thing was a pain to put together because the directions weren’t very clear, it was just pictures with arrows everywhere. However the product itself is excellent and is very functional for what we needed.

reviewTitle: Great price, lots of options, somewhat confusing setup
reviewDescription: This has been a surprisingly solid mount although I must say it was a bit difficult to set up even though I had a standard 400 x 400 vesa pattern on my Samsung 50inch 4K UHDTV (UN50KU6300 to be exact).Pros:-Ablility to use it on only 1 stud if need be-Offers full motion and tilt in a very compact design and at half the price of competitors options-Very versatile with many different screws and spacers included it should fit almost anything in its size rangeCons:-Somewhat obscure/confusing instructions. Amazon seems to have gone kinda Ikea style with the instruction manual. There was almost no verbiage describing the different diagrams and it’s was very unclear which screws corresponded with which mounting types.-No documentation related to specific TV brands. It  would have been very helpful if Amazon provided something like a guide to the most common screws/spacer combinations for the major TV brands or sizes so you didn’t have to just guess and try diff ones over and over again.-Cable Management seems to have been an afterthought. All they provided was a small u-shaped plastic thing that I guess was supposed to wrap around all your cables and then hang there I guess??Overall given that I only payed $20 for this mount I can’t complain too much although I must say I was expecting set up to be a little more intuitive just based on the fact this was an Amazon-made product.  If you were looking for something cheap and you are trying to minimize the amount of damage to your walls this is not a bad option just be prepared to spend double the amount of time you THINK it should take! :)

reviewTitle: Excellent, sturdy, just wish it would extend longer
reviewDescription: Incredibly built and sturdy, easy to install by one person (except for lifting TV). It’s great that it swivels 180 degrees each way (I don’t understand why some much more expensive ones like Sanus don’t!). The tilting adjustment is a little loose after just loosening the screw just a little bit, which then results in an abrupt drop of the TV forward which freaks you out when it happens. Any way to make that smoother?).  I just wish Amazon would sell one that extended just about 2-4 inches longer (28 or 30 inches) because that would ensure a 65” TV could swivel almost completely 180 degrees (length of such a TV is about 57 inches).Other than that this is an *incredible* value compared to almost all other mounts.  Really makes you feel that Amazon basics products are reliable.

I was able to use the mount, and it does work nicely. However, look at the picture attached. The directions show this piece mounted in reverse- (the amazon logo needs to be pointed towards the TV, so you can't see it when mounted).  Doing it their way makes it impossible to hang.  You also definitively need 2 people to hang this.  I've mounted 6 TVs previously and this was the biggest PITA so far.  Lastly, my old Samsung has a bulge @ the bottom, so I had to take the parts to the miter saw and cut it short.  (See second photo).
I had actually ordered a different one that wouldn't fit, luckily my friend needed one and it did fit his TV. I ordered this one and had to remake it so it would fit.

reviewTitle: Keep the product page open when you try to install it.
reviewDescription: When it arrived, the instructions were a bit unclear.  Very complex pictograms with no words.  Think Ikea instructions but way more complex.  The version of the install manual on the Amazon product page, and the accompanying video, made things MUCH clearer.  The overall installation is pretty straightforward once it's explained in the video and with words.When installed properly, this thing is STURDY.  I have an older flat screen TV that's smaller but heavier than you'd expect, and the mount holds it just fine.  Just make sure yours is within the weight and screen size limits and you'll be ok.

reviewTitle: Easy to install but use own bolts.
reviewDescription: This is great for the cost. I ordered one before and I had forgot that I needed to get my own bolts. It come with the metric system sizes and they are super long. I needed bolts that were 2". Once I used the correct size bolts it made it simple to install. This is a great stand for our in home gym.
It does not tilt up and down. Other than that I have no issues l.

I was a little concerned about how sturdy this mount was gonna be. I have an older flat screen I wanted to hang in my home gym but it’s a lot heavier than the new tv’s. Once I pulled it outta the box, it felt well made. Once I anchored the mount to the stud and hung the tv, it was clear the mount was gonna do the job. (I highly recommend mounting to a stud and not using the wall anchors to mount in the dry wall. Unless it’s a smaller, really light tv) happy with this product!
Works well for multiple tv's. Kind of a pain to set up but once you have it figured out it makes sense.
The instructions need to be better , but it works, with that said, why does it swivel to the right?

Installing with the template to a single stud- easy. 3 lag screws are more than secure.Installing mounting plate to 32” LG- almost too easy, but I was looking for 6mm flat washers. Lots of 8mm spacers and washers, but no 6mm? (5mm?) I used my own 6mm flat washers to install the plate directly to television, couldn’t ask for easier alignment.Easy to hang the TV on the arm- you’ll want a friend to use the supplied level to make final mounting easier.All in all, it’s a solid mount, really easy for a “small” TV.

reviewTitle: Terrific wall mount. The screws...not so much.
reviewDescription: This wall mount is actually impressive, and I see absolutely no reason why any other one would be needed for TVs of the intended size. I was originally concerned it would not back up close to the wall, but it does this as well as the non-swivel wall mounts. The only issue worth calling out: the low-quality screws. Both of the ones I tried to insert into the wall bent about halfway in, which ofcourse was frustrating. I bought new, sturdier ones from the hardware store and everything worked seamlessly.
Práctica fácil de montar
This is well made, the negative I found. The support bars hang below the tv set

I ended up with the right hardware & screws, in the multitude of bolts and parts, so there's enough in here to fix basically ANY type or size of TV. I put it into the studs and this thing is definitely confidence-inspiring for its durability and stability.
It's decent quality and works well for us. However, if you are not intuitively able to assemble objects, then this mount may not be the best choice for you. The instructions are lacking.

reviewTitle: Unclear Instructions, But Sturdy TV Mount
reviewDescription: The TV mount itself is strong, sturdy and versatile.  I found the assembly instructions difficult to understand, with poor instructions and poor diagrams.

I would have given this a 5, but did notice that when a gust of wind hits, it tends to move the TV from the stowed position.  That's just a minor problem compared to the cost, so this is definitely a great deal!
The actual mount is great, but the instructions are terrible. Make sure to review install manuals before getting started.
Works as advertised for me tv.
Very nice product.  Great quality.

reviewTitle: Ok for light duty. Suggest tooth washer for wall mount screw.
reviewDescription: I went outside of the specs which as I recall are 70 pounds and 40 inches. Mine is 65 inch (way over) and 44 pounds (Fine).I got it to work in a fixed state but it is not heavy duty enough to move the TV around much and stay even. The tilt is with a wrench.One thing omitted was a tooth washer for against the wall bracket and another washer over that to keep the wall bracket firm with the screw that should go into a stud and wall bracket. I would say a tooth washer is a requirement for all but the smallest TVs.Extremely difficult to mount yourself at 40 pounds. Would want ideally 3 people.This should work OK up to a guess of 24 pounds.

reviewTitle: Make sure it’s on the right way
reviewDescription: Spent an hour trying to hang it up and couldn’t get the pieces to connect/ hang. Finally realized the part that screws on the back of the tv was the opposite way. The “Amazon basics” logo should be against the tv. (Not visible) after flipping it, we got it hung in 2 seconds lol. See pic for how it is supposed to look.

Easy to install.  Keep the included level handy in case the TV gets off center if you opt to not lockdown the left-right tilt, up and down tilt with a screw.Install Tip:  Measure the distance between the top of the TV and the center bolt hole on the mount.  Use a stud finder.  Drive the center bolt about 3/4 in on the wall mount into the stud at the desired height.  Level the bracket and mark the top and bottom holes with a pencil.  Install all three bolts.  Bingo.  You're ready to mount the TV.  Best to use two people.

This is a very sturdy, solid TV mount that is well built and has a great range of motion.  For the price you really can’t beat it. I also love the fact that you only need to drill into one stud to mount it, which really provides great flexibility on the mounting location.  The install instructions are terrible though. Like many others, they’ve opted to go with illustrations/ pictures and very few words, I assume to prevent the need to print in a bunch of languages.  Problem is, the pictures aren’t clear on which direction the plates should face and some of them just make no sense. Aside from that- this is a great item that I’d recommend.
The only thing I didn’t like some of the tops were hard to open

This is a well constructed TV mount that comes complete with everything needed.  I used it on a 43 inch Roku TV.  The setup for 17 inch mounting hole spacing on the Roku left about 2 inches of the lower arms protruding from the bottom of the tv, kind of unsightly.  I cut off the ends of those 2 lower arms which took care of my issue.
Thanks
Good purchase, sturdy and had all the needed pieces to get it right for your brand of TV

It's a bit heavy and the instructions weren't all too clear. It comes with any possible screw you will need (extra in case your tv has a different size).  I've installed smaller and non swivel mounts before, this one was a bit different and took me a little longer to get up. I'm pretty handy and this one gave me a little struggle. Make sure to have a drill, twist drill bit and even a handheld wrench. Overall though, good price and not too bad to put up.

Product and provide tools made for an easier installation. Completed this solo and in less than 30 minutes. Currently holding up a 43" tv for the past couple months without issue. However, I did snap a bolt when mounting the plate to the stud. Be sure to predrill deep enough and don't over torque the bolts to avoid any problems.
The design has unnecessary complications.

I really like this stand it’s really easy to install. It is very well priced compared to the competition.Only issue: the mounting screws we’re too large for a dry wall/ seam setup. The large screws provided are ideal for concrete setup. I had to make a run to Home Depo to get screws that could be used on drywall/ seams.

reviewTitle: Not bad, worth the price, has flaws
reviewDescription: It works, so it's worth the price.However, it does have some pretty big flaws in my opinion:The hooks from the vertical bars are small, so they're hard to catch on the horizontal bar.  This resulted in me scratching up the wall behind the tv a good bit while trying to mount it.The mount puts the TV too close to the wall, resulting in it being hard to connect the tv and route the cables behind it.The tilt adjustments are impossible to change once the TV is mounted.  Adjustments must be made off the wall and then re-mount the TV.The strings or pulls hanging from the bottom of the vertical bars are the only way to remove the tv from the mount.  These will hang WAY below all but the largest of TVs using this mount.  I had to tape mine to the rear of my TV to keep them from dangling.The instructions are awful.  But they shouldn't be necessary if you are used to installing things like this.It comes with plenty of mounting hardware, but it's a guessing game as to which one fits your TV.  They're labeled as Letters in pouches, which are not referenced at all by the instructions.The built in spirit level isn't even close to accurate.  Use at your own risk.I won't be returning it, but I would not purchase again.

So I trusted that this was universal for all flat screens and that was NOT The case.  I made the mistake of drilling three holes into the concrete block of my garage and THEN realized that the TV mount did not fit the mounting holes of my flat screen. I had to buy extra metal strips and attach the mount to those strips.  Make sure your TV has mounting holes near the center and not at the corners only like mine.  BUT this is an awesome mount and it does work well now that I fixed it.
Instructions are horrible. We had to figure it out on our own. There are just a bunch of pictures with no explanation. I suppose it works good enough if you can figure out how to use it

I originally purchased a mount for my 43" tv at a big box store. The mount required to be installed on 2 studs 16" apart.  However, mine are more like 24" apart. Needless to say, I returned it. I went on Amazon and this appeared to be mounted on one stud. However, in all the instructions it said it needed to be mounted on 16" sections of studs...soooooo confusing because it was mounted on one stud.  I'm a rather handy person and a college graduate (whatever that means anymore) and it literally took me 5 hours to figure out what the heck the instructions were trying to say!!!...and I still had no idea. Once you throw out the instructions and figure it out for yourself it should take about half an hour. They are literally the WORST instructions I've ever seen!... and I've put together all sorts of things. Amazon makes so many products and things that are user friendly and this was so laughably strange, I thought I was on Candid Camera. Bottom line, I'm not sure about the whole 16" stud thing and dont pay attention to the directions. After 24 hours, my tv hasn't fallen off the wall (fingers crossed). Happy drilling.
Delivered 2-day late,, otherwise item as described in add. Shipping was terrible.

Overall it's a great product. I want to say that first and foremost. The instructions, however, are so incomplete that you're left searching online for what all of the extra hardware is for. I get that it comes with extra pieces to fit just about any TV, however there's no documentation for what piece to use in what situation. There are some helpful videos out there if you search for the product name on Google, just be prepared for a bit of frustration when installing. Again, overall I'm happy with how it works, just wish the instructions were more complete.

reviewTitle: Bad physical Instructions - Bad quality bolts - Great everything else
reviewDescription: The construction of this is decent enough but there are a couple of things that make it a headache.1. The instruction manual is in something like 10 languages and it is all jumbled together so it is not user friendly at all. just watch the video they have on here it is much better than the manal2. The lag bolt heads are soft, so if you are using a drill vs a socket wrench watch out! If you dont drill the pilot hole to the correct depth, an impact driver will strip the bolt in a matter of seconds once you hit true resistance. They are a very shallow phillips head as well, beware of that and use the correct bit. Even a socket wrench stripped the sides of the bolt.

reviewTitle: For $8, it's ok, but wobbles more than I would like.
reviewDescription: For $8, it's ok, but wobbles more than I would like.  The way the lower spring pin fits, allows the screen to wobble in place.  I would not buy it again, but for $8 I'm not taking it down.

The unit is a solid fabricated device. It came with good instructions. and was easy to mount.My problem: My customer wanted a mount that had 180 degree rotation. This unit was advertised to have 180 degree rotation and was rated for up to a 55" TV. I mounted a 40" TV for my customer, and when I tried to move to the 180 degree position, it hit the wall. I can't imagine where a 55" TV would have landed.I have an unhappy customer.Tom

reviewTitle: Do not trust the attached level that was inserted into the mounting frame. It was off
reviewDescription: The whole concept of this is great. It is made to be very simple and designed to make mounting simple. That is great if the level that is inserted into the mounting rail is actually level. Nothing like completing the job, hooking up all the wiring, then sitting back to watch tv and admire the job accomplished. Until you NOTICE,,,,,, It is crooked. Took me a bit to try again, wasted time, only to use a level I had to see that the provided mounted level is OFF! So I recommend you have an external level before trusting the framework included. Anyway, after all is said and it is done. I do like it, it was just frustrating until the issue was self discovered.

reviewTitle: Good Motion, Good Mount, Bad Install Instructions.
reviewDescription: I used a different mount on a larger tv, but didn't care for the range of motion. It was pretty easy to install that one. This one was a pain in the rear to install on a 55" TV.  You'd have to be very strong and a little lucky to mount this one alone. If you don't have help, maybe try a different type of mount.The problem is the way the back brace attached to the TV fits into the mount on the wall. It's a small circular whole, and the mount on the wall has a circular lip to place into the hole which holds the tv so you can put the bolts in.  Maybe if you have a lot of experience blindly putting large things in holes and can hold a larger tv up by yourself for a long time, you can do it... But the mount may move unless it's flush against the wall, but then you can't see where the circle is at all.  I had to get help so my TV laid on the floor for a while.The instructions are also very unclear.  I went through them several times.  Even with reading glasses I had a lot of WTF is that garbled number thingy.  I eventually gave up on the instructions and used logic to piece it together.It's a little awkward that if you want the TV flush to the wall, you don't install the bracket in the center of the tv.  Be prepared to measure a lot.to get the placement right (and hope you find a stud where the mount goes - thankfully, I did)  I wanted to be able to move the tv to the corner when viewing, and push back flush against the wall afterward. It definitely fits that purpose and the motion is smoother and easier than the other mount I installed (with easier installation on the other mount).In the end,the mount is sturdy and I have no fear it's coming off the wall anytime soon. Now that I've done it once, I'd buy the mount again should I ever need one, but if you need clear instructions, this isn't it.
I like it hanging in there nice and sturdy no issues with it

So I bought two of these for dual monitors, I wanted a standing desk and my monitors on the wall. My monitors serve several purposes, I work from home and I also use them for my crafting projects, and just to watch/stream tv when I'm in my office and not working. I needed my monitors to move, turn, and adjust. I purchased these because of the price point and because the reviews were solid compared to other versions. I've also been dabbling in Amazon basics and really like their products so far.To mount these I first mounted a piece of plywood to the wall, there was no way I was getting both mounts into a stud and still getting the range of motion I needed, plus having them side by side for work. The plywood was directly mounted into the studs, then I mounted the brackets to the plywood. It's been up for several months and I'm pleased with it so far.I have one issue, the holes to mount the monitors, while plentiful, only mounted my monitors slightly high on these mounts, so I can see the bottom of the square the monitors mounted on. There was no way around this, I tried every way to get them mounted lower, but they were the only holes that lined up. As a result, and because I wasn't prepared for it from the get go, my monitors around about four to five inches higher than I had intended them being. I can move the brackets down if it bothers me, but I don't want to deal with it again, I just wish I had known to look out for it prior to mounting, so I could have redone my measurements. I would still purchase these again if given a chance and I do like them otherwise.
Tasty

I got this product to mount my 32" Samsung TV above my computer monitors to act as a 3rd monitor/tv for my game room. The installation was easy and it works great as intended.My only issues with the product is the instructions could bit a little more clear, but I already have experience with TV mounts so I was able to get through it easily. And my other issue is that I wish the part that mounts to the wall had screw setting holes that slide down onto the screw and keep the mount in place while you tightened like some other mounts have. Would have made mounting on the wall solo much easier.Still a great cheap product. 4 out of 5 stars!
Good quality and motions.  But won't fit all tvs. Had to adapt it to work on our LG tvs
but the install is pretty easy after you figure out the hardware

I really, really like this unit.  Compared to others, its a beast on steroids.  Rock solid stable, with far more range of motion than I expected.  But it does have some drawbacks.  First, I would suggest installation be done either by two people, or one very strong, highly coordinated person.  I say that because lifting and placing the TV onto the mount's TV support rails is real tough.  I ended up having to tape the arms together so they would not move out of position.  The main drawback, though, is the method they use for mounting the TV.  It has these wide rails that extend 18-20 inches side to side.  Its a good idea since it lets you further adjust the side to side placement.  Plus you can adjust the height of the TV by attaching the brackets higher or lower on the TV.  BUT, on my TV they pretty much obscure the place where you do most of your connections.  I ended up having to replace my perfectly good optical cable with one that has a right angle connector just to get an audio connection.  That is the good news...….I cant even get to some of the other connections for legacy peripherals with old tech outputs.  That forced me to buy a Component to HDMI converter for about $30 to hook up an ancient DVD player.  Yeah, I could have purchased a new blue ray player, but at 2X-4X the cost of the converter.  But who buys discs these days with streaming so easy and inexpensive?  I think that if they had an option to somehow reduce the length of the rails, but I doubt anything I say will have any bearing on how they design, or re-design their product.  Just be aware that there is an issue you need to be aware of if you purchase this otherwise excellent product.
We are happy with this product! It is easy to install and worth the money. We like that we can turn the tv in different directions.
Easy to install
Missing parts and won’t fit the television. By the time I got around to opening this thing it was too late to return. Still no excuse for not having all the parts.

reviewTitle: Cheap pot metal bolts caused $1000's in damage, Amazon CS is worthless.
reviewDescription: The mounting screws for this unit are undersized cheap garbage and sheered off in the wall, yes we drilled a 5/32 pilot. The problem is we were putting it into a very expensive ship oap fireplace. When it sheared it twisted causing damage to the ship lap.  To fix it we now have to have the fire place mantel and surround removed, all the trim, crown molding and fireplace tile replaced, then the shiplap from top to bottom replaced because of color match. This will easily approach $2000 because Amazon cheaper out with a $0.06 cent garbage potmetal bolt instead of $0.25 bolts.What's worth is all I got from Amazon was, sorry, please return the product to the store. Not even the slightest bit of how can we make this better, or keep the mount and go buy your own bolts but here is a refund. He'll give a customer some credit for something or offer to send someone to do the repair your garbage product cost.The last picture is the bolts from my Omni mount ... Those are real bolts, bolts you can trust to hold a TV and not snap of in your wall.

This problem exists with most mounts so I was hoping an Amazon mount would be compatible with a Fire TV, but it isn't. The arms that are required to fit the Fire TV holes (300mm L and W) end up sticking out the bottom of the TV and are visible if mounting this way. I will be keeping the mount and just cutting the arms to make it work but that's a ridiculous step I need to take.

reviewTitle: None if the screws provided fit
reviewDescription: I have a 32 in ONN TV to mount in my kitchen. None of the screws provided fit. Only 1 spacer size was provided. It doesn't fit. It will have to be returned. I think its better to just go with the same brand as the TV for the wall mount.
Used this to hang a 42" TV, it is barely stable bit I feel I'm stuck with it since it's already installed. I would really look at the TV your using vs the sizing holes of this mount.
I’m sure this is a good product and it looks like it’s a universal fit except with the LG TVs. I wish what was mentioned in the description.

I've mounted a few TVs to the wall before, but this was my first time using Amazon Basic mount.  It came with the worse instruction manual.  Hard to understand drawing with no text instructions to follow through.  It was like playing Pictionary, trying to figure out what the instructions are trying to tell me.  On top of that, the smaller washers did not fit the smaller screws.  I finally got it mounted, but it was the most frustrating process and spent much longer than anticipated.

The metal used to manufacture the screws and included tools are made of very soft metals.  This results in stripping of the screws.In addition, the measurements used on the hex bolts do not correspond to the metric system or imperial.  I was unable to use any ratchet heads to fit what was included.I ended up having to go to Home Depot and purchase all of the mounting screws and bolts to actually make this work.

reviewTitle: Most frustrating experience hanging a tv I’ve ever had
reviewDescription: I’ve hung 100+ tv’s. This was the absolute worst experience I’ve ever had. I wouldn’t wish this on my worst enemy. I’m seriously so mad right now.
Too short

My mount was clearly a returned product that was just resold to me. Mount is dirty and scratched up, instructions are torn and several items are missing from the delivery content list. Don’t buy this.

reviewTitle: Not worth the money. Look elsewhere.
reviewDescription: This mount fit my 46" Phillips plasma TV, but this TV is heavy at around 60 lbs. That meant I had to make sure that I mounted it into wall studs. Although the product pictures show the mounting bracket with full width mounting holes, mine only had holes on the ends, not spaced enough to allow hitting two studs that would allow me to keep centered on the wall. So, since I'm going to replace this TV with a larger one, I decided to use it anyway with this TV slightly off center on the wall. Beware of the stud positions before you decide to buy this thing.The built in level is nice and makes marking holes easy.Like other reviews have stated, the tilt friction knobs are totally useless. No matter how hard I tightened them, the TV flops down to the maximum tilt position. The only way I can get the TV to stay in a more level position is to put a block of wood behind it.I do NOT recommend this mount. There are better ones out there at good prices.

Mollys are cheap and bolts sent with would be fine for stud install but screw seemed to blow out back of Molly for drywall install and screw just kept spinning. I’ve installed plenty of tv mount and hang with Molly use very often. Bought different Mollys to complete job.There are better options and easier to install options with better hardware on Amazon.  Keep shopping!
Tried to use for mounting a standard 55 in lg tv. Bracket does not line up do yourself a favor and buy a model specific mount

The TV hasn't yet fallen off the wall. That's pretty much all I have that's good.There were obvious quality issues upon opening. There was a loose locknut on the pivot of one of the tilt mechanisms. Those mechanisms themselves are pretty junky - impossible to adjust the friction once the tv is on the wall, but that doesn't matter because it's pretty much either "won't budge" or "flops down".By far the biggest issue is a misalignment of the attachment arms that results in an unlevel TV.  As the attached pictures show, the wall plate is perfectly level, but the TV is askew.  That's totally down to slop in the brackets themselves.  I think I can jury rig a shim to take out the slop, but it's a total failure on one of the most important functions of a TV mount.Spend the money on a better option, you're going to wish you had.

Got the product .. package did not have the screws to hang included. Didn’t realize until threw away packaging etc. Disappointed cost about a extra $20 out of pocket to get rest of hanging things needed for proper hanging
The instructions are confusing. It says there are install videos, but they're actually aren't. What a pain.

The mount is ok I guess, but the tv is a bit wobbly and more importantly the included hardware is absolute hot garbage. Two of the included screws to attach the mount to the tv broke when snugging them, requiring me to drill them out of the tv, which chewed the threads of the insert and required then to be tapped. Turned into a frustrating hour long project. Never again, Amazon Basics. Spend the extra $5 for a real brand.

Honestly, I hate to leave bad reviews but this was the horrible purchase probably the worst purchase I’ve ever made on Amazon in the last 11 years. Nothing is right at all and doesn’t feel secure once the TV is connected. I will never purchase this again.

I am not trashing on the bracket.  It seems good quality.  The fault was with amazon who recommended this wall mount bracket for my tv and it doesn't fit.  Not even close.  This bracket does NOT fit the tcl 55r635 tv.  Neither does the other one amazon recommended for a 55" tcl, an Elived.  I have now purchased 2 wall mount brackets that amazon recommended for my tv and neither one fit.  If you purchase this model tv, do not expect amazon to suggest the right wall mount.  If anyone knows of the right bracket to wall mount the tcl 55r635, i would appreciate your input.
Super easy install. Has a level and template for the wall. Many different options to attach to your TV. Articulation is solid and easy.

Got this mount for my daughter's 55" TV and it looks great in their room.  This is my second one of these mounts and if I need anther one, I wouldn't hesitate to get this one.  It had all of the included hardware (which some brands don't always include), a template if you need it to hang on the wall, good instructions and outstanding range of motion.  Don't pass this one up.

I'm a 70 year old woman and I purchased this in order to get the large flatscreen TV off the dresser and higher on the wall. It sat on the floor in the bedroom for about 6 months while I waited for my boyfriend to install it.  Finally, when he was on a trip out of state, I decided to install it myself.I unpacked it, checked the box contents, measured and marked the wall as per the instructions, drilled holes and put the whole thing together. I had never done anything like this before, but the job went perfectly. The hardest part was lifting the big screen TV up high enough to hook it on the support bracket and even that was achieved without too much fuss. (And I didn't drop the TV even once.)When he returned from his trip, my boyfriend wanted to know who installed the bracket and hung the TV because he had bought another bracket for the TV upstairs. When I told him I did, he didn't believe me.The following week he went to the flea market for the day and when he returned, I had the second bracket installed upstairs and just needed help to lift the heavier TV onto the bracket.I guess it's never too late for an old lady to learn new tricks!
Product worked great for us.
Added tv to our back screened in porch this summer. This mount was easy to install. It’s moves easily and gives us great versatility in where we sit to watch tv. Size is perfect for our 32 in tv.
it's the best
Love it.
Third mount for me and the best. The design is great. Mount goes on the wall, piece goes on TV back and you simply hang the TV onto the mount then secure with two screws. Ingenious those Chinese.
Works great
While this is a very quality product, the mounting plate did not match the holes in the back of the TV. The "X" design prevented mounting.
Installed quickly and does the job.
very easy to install and mount on the wall. had a ton of screws and spacers to make it easy to install.

Amazon Basics does a great job with their TV mounts, and this one is no exception. Easy to mount, and excellent range of motion. Extends and folds back in place easily. The only thing I would improve on would be if it could extend just a little longer out from the wall. At the high end of the TV width range it doesn't quite turn all the way to the left or right when extended, though that's a minor inconvenience.
It’s mounted on a concrete wall and has held up a 55” with ease. Pretty easy to mount and put together and really strong screws. Great value for the price.
Easy to install, has been up over a year and still holding.

reviewTitle: Very nice and heavy duty mount offering great tilt ranges but 1 problem...
reviewDescription: This is a very strong, yet inexpensive TV mount that comes with everything and more you could need to mount most any TV.  However, the bubble level built into the mount was off a bit so don't trust it.  Before I drilled my holes for the lag bolts I double checked the levelness of the bracket with my contractor's level and also a smart phone level app and they both confirmed the built-in level was off a bit.  Now, many people may not notice it but I would.  I mounted a 55" TV and decided to only use 2 of the 4 included massive lag bolts.  There is just no need to drill 4 holes in a wall and sink 4 lag bolts for a 55" TV but if you are up in the 70"-80" range maybe?  Anyway, having the expanded tilt range allows a TV to be mounted higher and still properly pointing at you.  I put this one in a spare bedroom so with one's head on a pillow in the bed the TV is still aimed directly at guests.  Anyway, a great value for the price and the fact that the mount is one piece and wide means you can tap 2 studs that may not be centered where you want the TV to be and still get the TV perfectly centered for your room along the mount.  Yes, this is a 2-person job no doubt and it takes some time... as they say, measure 2 or 3 or 10 times and then drill once so everything ends up just where you want it.  Adding 1 more hint... If you are going to mount a TV higher like I did and you need to angle it down more you want to attach the 2 brackets to the back of the TV so they are as low as possible so the bottom of the TV doesn't hit the wall when tilted down.  So, when you are putting the 2 brackets on the back of the TV you want the top holes on those 2 brackets screwed into the 2 top holes on the TV.  Then adjust put the other 2 screws into the lower holes on each side.  I did this first so I could then measure and know where to place the permanent mount on the wall that requires drilling and sinking those lag bolts into 2 studs.

So easy, a girl can do it!! I wanted to mount my TV on my wall so I bought this to get the project done. I just needed a few basic tools to get it done and found the instructions easy to follow and installation was overall easy! So glad I took a chance and ordered it as I love the finish product....and, it was SO easy and the price was so great, I bought a second one for another room!
Used this mount to hang a very tricky corner TV at my rental. It was easy to install, super durable, moves around well, fit in the space well & Was good value for the money
Works great and has a lot of options for different tasks. Pretty easy to assemble and looks nice. Adjusts well and is perfect for what we needed.

Every now and then you find a product that exceeds your expectations. This is a strong, well built TV wall mount excellently designed with a huge range of motion.My only "complaint" is that the installation instructions are only in picture form and cover a ton of different mounting options. Once I understood which ones applied to my situation, installation was quick and easy.If you need a good stud finder, I ended up buying the Franklin Sensors ProSensor 710+ Stud Finder with 13-Sensors. Kind of pricey, but the two other stud finders I already owned were terrible. Franklin also has a 9 sensor version that costs less and has good reviews.

Come on Amazon Basics. Do some people not have white walls?  Spray painting this was cumbersome.I just wish I would have made sure my TV fitted it.  If not I will sell it to some one who wants white.Spray painting pains.Update - neighbor installed for me without looking at instructions. If you have someone to install it properly, it will be mounted solid!  Excellent durability.If your installation is wobbly- then it was installed incorrectly - dont blame it on the product.Pros:Looks as if it is floating in the air. Love that.Very solid mounting as long as it is installed properly.Don’t have to use reading glasses anymore in order to see words on the screen.Cons:I do like the range, but I wish it would be kept fully extended out when turning it left or right.Otherwise when you turn it after it is max extended out, it will go back near the wall.Also a tilt up/down feature would be helpful for certain viewing.

As a building and electrical contractor I was able to figure this out pretty easily. because I have high mechanical aptitude and 60 years of experience. The average person would be overwhelmed by the sheer number of small parts (I used 8 out of 60) and instructions that are not only contradictory but missing any description of the installation process. The arm hinges in 3 spots but the middle spot is really stiff. The arm does allow my little 29" TV to turn 90 degrees which was the one feature I was looking for.

reviewTitle: You will never get it perfecly level.
