reviewDescription: There is just enough play in the mating mechanism to ensure no matter how many times you use a level or just say eff it and jog the wall piece back and forth, the panel will rock slightly to the right or left once it latches in. Not majorly but if is it's near anything that is plumb you will kind of notice. Not easy to install given you cant make any adjustments without removing the panel again and again and again and not sturdy as the 2 components don't mate smoothly.
The TS screws, M6 x 50 and U8 were missing from the package.

reviewTitle: Cheap materials / seems like an okay mount.
reviewDescription: I have just installed this product. I didn’t not read through all the reviews. Just a few. And my issue seems to be isolated. When tightening The last lag bolt into the wall the head snapped right off. So there’s two good bolts. And the third is useless.The installation process was very simple.  Someone mentioned there were only two methods to install the bracket and both were very difficult. Well there’s a third.  The third is to take off the 2 security screws on the back of the mount. And the tv mount plate lifts right off. Then you need two people to place the tv back onto the little lip once everything is secured to its respectable place.  The tv holds itself up like that.  Then the security screws keep it there.All and all. It seems okay. But the parts just seem to be on the cheaper side. If I ever bought again. I would go to the hardware store and buy better bolts to secure it to the stud. But for this price. That is still a better option than the $100+ mounts.

Very poor in instructions, had to redo some parts as the photos on the instructions didn't show which side was correct. Over all product is sturdy, does what I want it to do, but was a pain to install!

reviewTitle: labeling and instructions could be better.
reviewDescription: I installed on a 6x6 open post.  Finding the center of a 1 1/2" stud that's hidden behind sheet rock and using these big lag bolts would be hit and miss.The directions and especially the labeling are lacking.  A few more words or bigger pictures would have helped to know what bolt goes where and it would be nice if they told you the actual sizes of the bolts so people aren't left to guess which one will fit their TV.
But I would not trust it on a pricey TV.I would not buy again. But it does work.

reviewTitle: Doing its job, but wished I had bought something different.
reviewDescription: Serves a purpose and for the price, not bad but if I was going to do it again, I'd buy one that isn't fixed against the wall and had a better way to adjust it. On the upside, it came with a bunch of neatly packaged hardware, so you're bound to find what you need to mount a TV or Monitor. Don't plan on getting your arms in behind it once mounted, because its so close to the wall, you're going to either have to hook up cables beforehand, or have a partner hold the TV while you mess with it. Its definitely a 2 person job to hang the TV, and the only way to adjust the tilt is when the TV is pulled off the rail that mounts to the wall. Also, don't over tighten the bolts because it is fairly flimsy and bends to whatever shape your drywall is, making it nearly impossible to hook the TV onto the rail, and forget about trying to level it. Also the little level that's built into the wall mount is way off, so measure or use a legitimate level when installing it.
Worst installation instructions imaginable.

We have had this tv mount since the beginning of June. It is now beginning of October and I came home from work with my tv on the ground and a hole in my wall. Mount was fine and still attached to the tv, tv thankfully landed on a soft surface and seems okay, but now there’s a big hole in my bedroom wall. Quite unhappy with the damage done to my home from due to Amazon cheaping out on screws.

reviewTitle: Got it “New” but had clearly been used
reviewDescription: I order this for outdoors so I’ll keep it but wish I had been charged for what I was given. The mount was bent, level was broken. Bolts were cut out of packaging and taped together. Not to mention the whole box was tapped back together from getting ripped apart. Again it functions and is fine, I just wish I had gotten the discount for what was received.

reviewTitle: All my audio video plugs are concealed.
reviewDescription: I like its usefulness but I realized after I mounted it I can't plug into the jacks.

reviewTitle: Does it's job well but the installation was a pain.
reviewDescription: The screws to hold the rack seem to be made of cheap metal(s). They're pretty thick but a regular drill bit should not have chewed away at the screw head as easily as it did with these. It's extremely frustrating when you have to resort to options to get the screws all the way in or even pull them out as a result. I also don't know what everyone is talking about regarding the instructions. They're your typical horribly laid out steps with nothing but pictures.

reviewTitle: Not level level bubble, no verticals slits
reviewDescription: Built in level bulb shows frame level, it isn’t, use your own level.Nice heavy duty material.All the mounting bracket slots are horizontal $&@!? It’d be a ton easier to adjust for level if some were verticle

I installed this for my Mom in her bedroom and had a 55" TV.  The mount was not strong enough to support the TV when I tried to position it in the middle.  The weight of the TV would force it to move left or right.It would work fine on smaller TV's

reviewTitle: Was so close to having it done...
reviewDescription: Overall, the mount itself is good. The problem I ran into was the lag bolts. I had 2 of the 3 lag bolts tightened down, but as I was tightening down the last lag bolt, the lag bolt just snapped in half. Luckily, it broke somewhere behind the drywall in the stud, so I was just left with a hole in the wall and a broken off lag bolt somewhere in a stud. I shifted the bracket to a different vertical position on the same stud to hide the holes and started over. I had to back out the other 2 lag bolts, run to the store and grab a new lag bolt (I was able to use a 1/4" lag bolt to replace the broken one that came with the mount), and then finish the installation. Once installed, the mount itself is great.
different than was expecting, wasnt easy to put together the range isnt that great but does the job

I wasn't looking for anything special it works fine looks good my biggest issue was the selection of blots for the tv didn't have the size (m6 I believe) that fit the back of my tv.... it had them but they were too short....I had to run to home depot and pick up bolts that fit...thats my only problem is it doesn't have a wide variety of hardware to fit certain tvs.
I am disappointed, Useless directions utterly useless
